review_data.review: At least I found a restaurant in the Medina which serves beer (€ 5,00 per o,25 ltr. local Heineken can)!! The typical Maroccan dishes were good.

Wow, so impressed with not just the food, service but the owner herself! My brother-in-law planned a surprise 50th birthday celebration for my sister and Maria Loi was just wonderful to setup a back area table and be in on the surprise. The appetizers were all top-notch! The grilled octopus was tender and delicious and who knew that their tomatoes in the village salad would be so fresh and tasty! All of their spreads were so yummy and also loved their grilled halloumi. Wine selections were excellent and all paired wonderfully with our meal. They accommodated us by doing more 'family-style' with the main courses so we all shared and sampled. The branzino was delicate and light, lamb shank with orzo was tender and rich, and the eggplant was so delicious, it tasted like high-end shepherd's pie! We all had a sampling of their desserts with a flour less chocolate cake which was surprisingly delicate and chocolatey at the same time; a walnut cake that was so moist with honey and I can honestly say that the baklava was the best I've had!

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Family Vacationer

review_data.review: My wife and I visited having read about it in the your book and on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed.  The setting is wonderful, with beautiful decoration throughout. The staff were very attentive, pointing out little steps and filling out drinks throughout service.  My wife went for the Italian options whilst I went for the Moroccan. Both of us enjoyed our food immensely. The salads were delightful and each stood out as a well prepared/cooked dish. My beef tagine easily being the best I've experienced during my visit, with the meat falling away at a touch. My wife with her Italian dishes assured me the aubergine parmigiana was the best she's had, out of several trips to Italy and excellent restaurants. The pasta dish she had was also great.  Where I feel this missed out was that dessert was not great, but just ok. The dishes were decorated with chocolate and raspberry coulis, which tasted more like sauce for ice-cream. Finally, the service once we had finished seemed to disappear, as it took us quite a long time to get their attention to get the bill. By the time we did, we had both gone off the idea of getting a coffee to end the meal with.  So very close, but otherwise this is a great restaurant with some excellent cooking.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover

review_data.review: You arrive at a nondescript black door, with a number etched in the glass above. You think this could not possibly be a fine dining venue. Guests are quickly ushered in and up an equally unimpressive concrete staircase, into the dining area. Guests (all tourists from across the globe) meet and mingle over champagne and canapés before being introduced to the wonderful array of fresh meats that will be served later on. Seated around a long, wooden table, diners quickly find that, apart from the food, this is a very social experience and conversations soon develop, whilst course after course of the finest meats, salad and finally dessert are served, each paired with an excellent wine. Pricey, a bit touristy, but, over all, a great experience.

Love coming here. Always busy and always great. Book ahead if you’ve got time as you’d hate to miss out on great food and great sake. Lovely cold Kirin on tap and a good little wine list. If you’re not sure about which sake to order the staff are happy to help with advice and even tastings. Also a great selection of Japanese whiskies
Like so many hospitality venues in NZ, Post COVID, they are short staffed. Good cocktails and a good wine list. The snacks we had were very good

review_data.review_title: Really nice food and friendly staff
review_data.review: Great food ( beef couscous, chicken tagine). A bit more expensive than the corner cafe but still good value.

I'm a buffet hater and usually very unsatisfied after eating at one. The lunch buffet at Grill 63 was different, maybe the best buffet I've ever had.  A broad selection of Sushi, prepared dishes, freshly grilled (on order) dishes and desserts. All the dishes were hot and the ingredients, especially the meat of very high quality (among the best I had in Hanoi)  Reasonably priced at 500.000 vnd (around 20$).

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Beach Goer

review_data.review: We loved the pumpkin ravioli. Delicate flavors. Our waiter Walter took very good care of us. We’ll be back.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: We went there for dinner and after having tajin for the last 5 days we were very happy to get the Italian menu. Unfortunately, it wasn't as good as expected. Ravioli with white parmesan sauce was filled with... yellow cheese, making it all very chewy. The service was rather impersonal and only the surrounding stunned us. They definitely have better marketing than they can deliver in terms of running good restaurant.

review_data.review_title: Best steaks in Buenos Aires, trust me
review_data.review: Came for lunch today, wanted to eat a good steak, this place did the trick! From the moment we walked in we knew we had the right spot. Great restaurant, menu, service, and vibe for Argentinean grill!  We had the Arugula Salad with Parmesan, and it was excellent. They dress it for you too.  For lunch, we ordered the "Tablita de Carne" which is a 2pp platter of grilled meat. Was excellent too. But the best was the Paillard de Lomo - probably in the top 5 steaks I've had in the world. Trust me on this one. I also tasted the Medallon de Lomo (the thick cut) and it was insanely delicious too. We had a side of papas fritas too, which were huge.  In all, this is a very nice restaurant, not quite "fine dining" but in that genre. You will want to come back!

We feel compelled to leave a review for AKAR Restaurant in Ubud here. It’s quite new and I’m unsure if it’s overly mainstream, yet! It is hand-on-heart the best food I’ve ever tasted in my life. Packed with flavour.  We only found it by googling “best dinner in UBUD”  We tried so, so many places in Ubud, including Twist, Elys Kitchen, and many more — all amazing, by the way. However, we went to AKAR & our minds were blown. A notch above everywhere we’ve been at home and in Bali.  The atmosphere is unbeatable. The service is surreal, even for bali standards (already a high standard). The food - phenomenal.  The dark chocolate soufflé is out of this world, as is the warm brownies.  Ps: no, this is not “cheap & cheerful”, but it’s also not too far at the “fine dining” end of the spectrum either…. portions are good sized. It is truly a must.  Cocktails also unreal.  If you come to UBUD and don’t try this place, you’ve missed out (and Twist)  Finally - no, I’m not on commission ha ha. I am just on my honeymoon and had some of the best food ever & best service ever.  Special shout out to Kwai and Rian, our two servers they went completely above and beyond  Cheers!!

What an amazing and quirky place this is!! We rocked up and was told it was a 45 min wait for a table and that was ok. We got drinks and waited in the lounge area, what a fab room filled with mismatched old style furniture loved it! We actually waited around 20 mins for a table, we’d viewed a menu while waiting so ordered straight away. The burgers are so nice and the fries are another level! It may only be burger and fries but the whole place and food are fab!! The vibe is funky and we loved it!! Defo go again when next in Prague

Chicken Curry is the bonb We took aussie and khmer family tonight Seriously the food here is great and when busy it would be hard to get into But please try...well worth it We will come back before we leave

review_data.review_title: Absolutely fabulous Indian restaurant in Prague
review_data.review: I have eaten in Indian restaurants all over the world including South Asia, but this little gem in Prague's Karlin area, Czechia outclasses all of them by miles. The decor is very tastefully done, there's perfectly subdued music, the owner always greets his guests personally so you feel instantly at ease and welcome, the staff are professional and friendly and the food is just excellent and miles superior to what most Indian restaurants serve and all at very reasonable prices. If you like Indian food you'll love this place and like me want to return time and again.

review_data.review_title: Outstanding food with service to match
review_data.review: Took my wife to this restaurant tonight as recommended by the hotel (Lotus Blanc) I must say we had the most amazing experience, the staff were all superb, particularly Kia, and the food (we had the connoisseur menu) was out of this world, it was accompanied by wine, which for the price was very good value. I Can’t recommend highly enough, don’t let the name steak house fool you, this restaurant caters for a range of customers and if you want a special treat, this is the place to go.  I would dress up a little to enjoy it more!! Francis & Jill, from Scotland

review_data.review_title: Not so much choice on the menu but the food quality was good
review_data.review: I felt that the menu was a little small and found it difficult to find something I wanted to eat. Originally ordered a steak and was told it did not come with anything so went for the ravioli instead which was delicious - I just would have liked more choice.

Incredible. If you like lamb you can't miss Pedro's. There's one option on the menu, a large leg of lamb, with potatoes, to go. $50. We shared it between four of us with a side of coleslaw and some of their freshly baked bread. The lamb fell off the bone and was perfectly spiced / seasoned. Happy, happy...

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Located on the top floor of the Intercontinental Hotel, the restaurant has a wonderful view over the sprawling city of istanbul. The service is attentive but not obtrusive, timely but not rushed. The menu is predominantly traditional Turkish fayre - I had the fish soup and lamp kebab which was served on a bed of rice with steamed spinach. The food was well presented and full of flavour with adequate portion size. With a bottle of water and service it came to just over £30 which I felt was good value.

Made a booking at short notice, unfortunately I left the restaurant totally underwhelmed. Whilst I can’t really offer total criticism of the meal, I found most of the dishes to be bland. The Lamb Rogan curry tasted as though it was made with gravy...not a curry. I’ve eaten in many Indian restaurants in the world and there have only been a few that I would not return to, this is now one of them. The service was good and I’m sorry I can’t offer any praise for the $150 meal for two, with a bottle of wine and a gin/tonic. A final positive the naan bread was good!  I would not recommend or return...unless you like bland Indian food.

Enjoyed meal a lot. Tried paratha, naan, checken tandur, palaak paneer, paneer butter masala, mixed raita, chai, mango lassy (with fresh mangoes). All food had rich taste and in general was delicious, service was fine and warm welcomming. Will come back for sure

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler;Family Vacationer

review_data.review_title: Great Italian/Thai pizza place & superb coffee
review_data.review: We visit Ciao nearly daily while staying in Hilton. Pizzas, Pastas and Sea-bass are great, our kid loves crab meat soup, taco and lamb chops. Also they have great home made lemonades and smoothes. Thanks a lot to ms Bell and all the rest team for a great service. We will definitely come back - tomorrow for lunch. Please keep 2 coconuts for us :-) as we miss them if you don’t have them.
Going here every second day for lunch or dinner. We were really surprised by really great Italian picas and quit good pastas + amazing non alco cocktails: passion lover is our the best

review_data.review_title: Fantastic food and worthy of the praise
review_data.review: I had to take my little boy with me as Daddy bailed. The staff were so accommodating!! And lovely to him. He watched his IPAD nicely as I sampled the delights. My battery died so they charged my phone and I missed getting a pic of the mains but the portion sizes are huge. May sure you so here or to the sister Resturant. Throughly impressed and can’t wait to go back.

We booked due to the reviews and it didn’t disappoint. Small restaurant with hands on serves who can help you with the menu. It’s clean, simple and most importantly the food is exceptional. I tried a variety of wine and it’s good to know the menu varies from week to week. Love at first bite. If you are reading this you need to book. Can’t wait to go back.

review_data.review_title: A great experience, believe the hype!
review_data.review: We visited a few weeks ago on a Sunday. The service was second to none and the portions were huge. This is Poni restaurants newer and brighter sister but they both have a unique offering and laid back crowd. I love how all the staff speak English, that’s a real bonus for me as I try to learn French. The food was brilliant and the menu is similar to Poni bare a couple of dishes. Would go back and higher recommend dining here on your next trip to Paris

We came here on the recommendation of our hotel which was only a block and a half away. We had really excellent steak here - we both had the bife de chorizo and the meat was among the nicest I have ever had at reasonable prices given the quality. The salad and fries and Malbec were very good too.  I would recommend booking this place and highly recommend the meat. There are plenty of other dishes beyond the steak including other meats and pasta too. It deserves the positive reviews it gets. Service was friendly with some English spoken and it’s a nice traditional style parrilla restaurant.  The locals on either side of us shared steaks rather than take one of their own. The bife de chorizo steaks are big enough for two to share. Apart from cutting the cost down it also leaves room for starters and/or desserts - that’s an option worth considering.

We visited Wild Creative Bar and Eatery as part of a food tour and stopped here for desert and final drink. What an amazing place. The food and drinks were fantastic and the ambiance perfect. The owners serve everyone with passion and energy and are an amazing couple. Get there early to avoid disappointment as it is small, but don’t miss out on the desert springrolls, they absolutely fantastic. Make time to get to this place. Allow enough time here to just “chill out”.

I really didn't know what to expect from this restaurant as I only knew the brand from its clothes (which are great!). However the food was really tasty, great portions and welcoming service. I would recommend leaving room for desserts as these are great!! Beer draft selection & Cocktails very interesting and tasty also

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: One of our favorite places in New York. Always delicious. Always busy. Always friendly. this night was great as usual. The Gamberi Caprese - very interesting. Bucatini Cachio Pepe - sublime. Spaghetti Neri Lobster - a feast for the palate and the eyes. The Verdure Grigliate and Patae Limone rounded out the fare. looking forward to out next adventure at Piccola Cucina.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: This was a return visit and the anticipation was well-deserved. Every dish was a gastronomic experience to cherish. The Duetto Sandwich is hard to share but worth every morsel. Ravioli Funghi Salsiccia to die for. Cacio Pepe is a traditional Appulian dish done perfectly. Pachheri Seafood excellent. Patate Limoni and Verdure Grigliate great accompaniments. It is very noisy, but mostly from people talking and having a good time. Spontaneous dancing broke during our meal - just like dining in a local resto in southern Italy.

review_data.review_title: A Fine Dining Experience Not To Be Missed
review_data.review: Sea Fire Salt is an exceptional fine dining restaurant. We visited the restaurant three times during our Phuket Sandbox stay. Each time our dinner was cooked to perfection by the lady chef and her colleagues. Staff are attentive but not intrusive. In fact they enhance the experience with their relaxed and friendly manner.  To the food. In a word amazing! From the amuse bouche, the appetisers, the main courses and ending with an imaginative dessert, all were of the highest quality. Our personnel favourites - the beef tenderloin, the lamb chops and the sea bass both cooked on salt blocks - were cooked to the highest standard and were mouth-wateringly good.  If you stay at the Anantara please visit this excellent restaurant.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review_title: Not the experience we expected -- is it (becoming) a tourist trap
review_data.review: We booked the week before over the internet, nice site and nice treatment, so high expectations. They just mover location in BsAs. We checked the outside out before and found the place (not so easy). Arriving in time as required explicitly, many foreigners waiting, seemed a bit a cruiseship tour of overspending retired world travelers, not the hip and young people we like to be with... anyway. There was a power breakdown at the start... and not a real nice process to find a place to sit, instructions chaotic. Anyway we paid 200 USD for an experience but were quite disappointed. A minimal sald, some starters of low quality and undescribed and some cheese to be shared and a so-so quality steak (very low on our list of previous experiences in the USA or Colombia or Brasil or France). Dessert also average. Overall very disappointing to us. Fortunately the rest of our holidays really compensated for this bad start in a former garage without windows. Not recommended, though friendly people (who make an awful lot of US dollars instead of pesos).

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: After cocktail on the roof, your best choice is two have dinner at Cloud Nine Restaurant. Food is absolutely good as well as presentation. Thanks to Katie the waitress.
Many year we come in phuket but never tried this lovely place, food atmosphere Just...Perfect! Fore sure we will come back again and again! Arrivederci!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover

review_data.review: A cute little place hidden inside an alley of the old quarter, which is cool. It’s not easy at all to find vegan food around here so I was extremely happy I found this place. Very generous portion, reasonably priced, the mock meat taste so great, above all the story of the owner is sweet and moving. Defo become a regular visitor myself at this place.
Fantastic! Amazing service,great atmosphere, fun food and drink options. Our server Johnatan was incredible. Friendly, knowledgeable and thorough.

user_data.user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Shopping Fanatic;Beach Goer

review_data.review: My wife and I had been traveling SE Asia for a month and enjoyed everything from Street food to Michelin star quality.  We where unsure where to try a 'high end' meal in Hanoi, after being given several inconsistent recommendations by previous visitors or tour guides.  For us, Cloud Nine fitted the bill perfectly and we enjoyed our first visit so much that we chose to return again on our final night in Asia.  Located in the La Siesta Hàng be Hotel, just below the rooftop bar (both reviewed elsewhere) its central to the Old Quarter but has far reaching views in all directions across the city. The decor is undoubtedly chic, with a hint of French presented with a wonderful Asian style and finesse.  They served a mix of Vietnamese and western food, although we only ate from the Vietnamese menu.  They offer a tasting menu at £17 per head but each night we chose to dine a la carte and spent a little more (approx. £25 excluding drinks) but the food, quality, preparation and presentation was absolutely first class.  What sets this restaurant apart though is the quality of service. Anyone who has traveled in SE Asia will know that, if you pay a little more, the quality of service is consistently good. Here it was truly exceptional.  From the very first moment, restaurant supervisor/ maitre d', Amber, ensures that you're welcomed, relaxed and served to your satisfaction. Not that she should have any concerns, as the staff are all, without exception, attentive and polite.  On both occasions we ate here, our server was Huyen. An absolute delight to deal with, her English was seriously impressive, indeed we found her easier to understand than some of our more heavily accented tour guides! She really exceeded any reasonable expectations of service.  On our return visit we were both treated like long lost friends and we'll take memories such as that away with us.  For the record, over our two visits, we ate the special chef spring rolls, Hanoi deep fried spring rolls, Phu Bo, asparagus and crab meat soup, Tom Yum Kung soup, green mango seafood salad, beef on hot stones and Tiger prawns in coconut. We never made it to dessert! In addition, they serve a complimentary amuse bouche to start and a refreshing drink to close.  A truly wonderful experience and I would highly recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Experiencing the tasting menu at this restaurant is my highest recommendation and top tip following a month long visit to SE Asia.  We are fortunate to have eaten some excellent meals on five continents but this restaurant served us one of top five meals of all time.  The restaurant is staffed throughout by females and, without wishing to sound sexist, I truly believe you can taste and experience their delicate and feminine touch throughout.  My wife and I were privileged to enjoy their seven course, regularly changing, tasting menu and were rewarded with some exceptional, exquisite tastes. Presentation and service were exemplary too.  Combined with a four glass classic wine pairing for me and a four cup tea tasting for my wife, the cost isn't cheap in Siem Reap terms but at $36 per person for food, $29 for four glass of paired wine or $15 for four deliciously flavoured teas, it's incredible value for money given the quality of food, presentation and service on offer.  In addition we were given complementary amuse bouche to start, had opportunity to thank one of the chefs direct and were given a leaving gift of their exquisitely presented, complementary macaroons.  An exceptional experience that I would repeat in a heartbeat, I cannot recommend this restaurant more highly.  Do not miss.

review_data.review_title: Unique cocktails in a wonderful bar.
review_data.review: Unfortunately we only just discovered this place on our last night in Hanoi but at least we discovered it then!!  Situated on the top floor of the stylish La Siesta Hang Be Hotel, there are many rooftop bars in the city but we found the cocktails here to be more adventurous than most.  The bar tenders/mixologists have really tried to come up with some unique flavours so as to capture the ‘feel’ of this exciting urban culture.  I tried the ‘Chef Inspired’ and ‘Guaranteed’: both enjoyable and unlike anything I’ve ever tasted before.  The views of Hanoi are spectacular and, on the floor below, is the ‘Cloud Nine’ restaurant which I have reviewed separately and loved. They also, of course, serve all the classics.  I would recommend trying this bar for some unique tastes.

No wonder the Wine O'clock Shop rates so highly on Trip Advisor, this place is a gem! Just finishing a meal here with great tapas, wonderful service and excellent wine. Waiter has excellent wine knowledge so trust him and try so local wines. The baked goats cheese is everything other reviewers suggest. Also enjoyed the ham and salami plate.

Visited for my husband’s 50th birthday. Exquisite food, beautifully presented with excellent service. We went for the 5 course taster menu, and added the caviar to start (one Beluga, one not for comparison) with the premium paired wines. Worth splashing for the extras. Our waiter was so knowledgeable about the caviar, food and wine and made it a really special occasion for us. The whole experience was extraordinary, one of our most memorable ever meals. Go for the taster menu and wines and put your trust in the extraordinary kitchen and front-of-house staff, you won’t regret it.

Our 2nd to last dinner in Paris and the best experience we've had on our entire trip.  At this small 10 table restaurant off the beaten path you have to: have reservations a month out and be somewhat adventurous because there is no menu whatsoever.  If you have any food allergies you tell them and from that point on, you're off on a fantastic trip. You have no idea what you are going to be served.  The menu changes by what is in season. All the dishes were out of the ordinary. The sauces, the presentation, the subtle flavors in each one were amazing and different.  I won't try to describe each dish but we had ingredients from exotic mushrooms to quail, from fish ( pollock ? ) to fresh grapes & tomato. It's a 7 course menu but we counted at least 9.  Expensive - yes - about 200 euro with the 4 wine tasting for both of us.  Every table was taken and we can see why.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: Best brunch we’ve had in long time. Food, service, atmosphere and interior - everything was top notch. Outside of a beaten tourist path, but well worth it.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover

review_data.review: I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough! After a week of tagine and couscous, it was wonderful to find a restaurant in Marrakech that served foie gras (poelee), confit de canard, filet de boeuf, lamb chops etc. The decor is quirky, with a “pseudo-industrial” feel, but the staff are efficient, enthusiastic, and all speak good English. The prices are not cheap, but the food quality is outstanding, so one leaves highly satisfied. We are not cocktail fans, but this is clearly a major attraction of this restaurant, indeed many people apparently come here just to drink them. The couple at the table adjacent spent several minutes photographing their cocktails before drinking them!

I loved everything about this restaurant, from the intimate atmosphere to the thoughtful service we received and the complimentary Czech wine at the end. The food is delicious and nicely served. It was also very good value for money. Recommended!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Like a Local;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Visited with my girlfriend after a long day of sightseeing an shopping. We chose this place due to the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We had the 3 course set menu which was great value. Bill was around $100 with tip for 3 courses and drinks.  Curry I very flavourful but not very hot, starters and appetisers were very nice. A traditional Indian ice cream for desert which was a bit strange at first but very nice. Would recommend for a nice Curry in NY, good central location as well, near Rockefeller Center.

The food is exceptional and the prices are so low it’s kind of embarrassing. Great food but also amazing vibe and energy seeing all the food prepared fresh. Definitely lived up to the hype, a must try for anyone in New York!
Whilst staying in the Sheraton I have used this place a few times for a good western food fix. Great steaks, service and wonderful staff. Not cheap but worthy of the price

Had a meal in here one night whilst in Hanio. Ordered the chef special menu, which was salad, soup, a great steak and dessert, which was well priced and perfectly executed, this really is a first class meal.

review_data.review_title: Utterly romantic Italian restaurant in the heart of the medina
review_data.review: This is a stunning and very romantic restaurant housed within a jewel-like riad which is tucked away down a narrow alleyway in the heart of the medina. Tables are situated around a pool and a central marble courtyard with a mosaic clad fountain. A large speaker provides some cool background beats. The restaurant offers two menus – Moroccan and Italian – with the ability to mix and match both. The latter offered a welcome break from the traditional tagines. The king prawns with diced tomatoes and cocktail sauce and the eggplant mozzarella for starters were both beautifully seasoned and bursting with flavour and the home made fettucine and tortellini parmesan cream for main brought back fond memories of some of the best Italian pasta houses. There is an extensive wine list although the Moroccan wine is slightly on the expensive side. The only downside was the service which can best be described as unfriendly and unengaging and we felt a little rushed with courses arriving quickly when we had indicated we would like a break or, in the case of the bill, unprompted. It was slightly odd to be taken to a back room to pay the bill by credit card but I had nothing to fear in that all of the staff were extremely courteous and polite. This was our stand out favourite restaurant during our nine night stay in Marrakesh and we cannot wait to return.  Tip: Ignore the young men waiting to greet you when you leave the restaurant who will seek to persuade you to follow them on a different route back to the main square on the basis that the conventional route is closed at night. This is a standard ruse at this (and many other) locations and an attempt to fleece you of your hard earned dirhams……

Located on an unassuming picture postcard South Kensington Street, Launceston Place is understated Michelin level cuisine at an affordable price. We had the three course fixed price lunch which came with a glass of fizz but with the option of choosing dishes from the a la Carte menu. The food was a real delight - creative food imaginatively presented and cooked to perfection; coupled with excellent suggestions from the sommelier. Everything was perfect and the service faultless - wonderfully attentive, engaging but not intrusive. This was an amazing dining experience and one we will undoubtedly be repeating - soon.

They take in disadvantaged youth - train them in life skills, work skills, hospitality management - being servers, cooks , chefs , managers etc. Then trainees are sent out to other hotels for internships and then after graduation they all find jobs in the local Siem Reap hospitality industry. A remarkable process. Train your staff well and they will look after your customers.

This is another amazing social profit enterprise. They take in disadvantaged youth. They train, educate, coach and mentor young adults to be self-sustaining and employed in today’s world. They also run a 1st class restaurant with excellent food, ambience and incredible customer service. Thank You for what you do.

This restaurant is a dream and a Haven for dis-advantaged youth. Paul and his wife ( owners) started this project in order to provide youth with an opportunity to acquire life, work and employment skills. Youth go through an internship process for a number of months. When they graduate they are hired at local high-end restaurants as they have excellent hospitality skills, knowledge abilities. So, when in Siem Reap you will have to eat , so I ask that you dine at this restaurant support their cause.

I found this restaurant on TA / the reviews are very good and decided to try one of it’s Khmer stir fry dishes the menu is varied and has Khmer, Thai and some western food choices as well. The chicken stir fry was excellent - lots of fresh veggies and lots of really nice breast of chicken. The sauce was great, thanks - will be back again .
Simply amazing menu choices - super fresh, healthy, wholesome, delicious and great customer service. Whoo Hoo I highly recommend this restaurant

we always stop in and have dinner or lunch @ Tevy’s Place. Tevy and her staff are so welcoming. Excellent service and menu choices at a very reasonable price. She brings in and trains young women in all aspects of running a restaurant. Thanks for being a successful entrepreneur and for training, coaching and mentoring young adults.

I love this restaurant. The food was s 12/10 , interesting ambience, great staff and excellent customer service . If you sit a front you can watch them cook your meal. All female staff. This place is another social profit enterprise. Tevy supports educational programs for disadvantaged youth - specifically females in Siem Reap. She deserves the Order of Cambodia. Pucs to follow

simply an amazing restaurant. Here is another example of a social profit agency that works the restaurant business and puts $$$ back into the community. You just have to go there. The food, music, decor, ambience and customer service is Outstanding.

As I said it was Ok, not Oh Woo Hoo amazing like the other reviewed. Now that being said It was mid afternoon and I stopped for chicken satay as an appies and had a glass of red vine. The server showed me the bottle and I reviewed the label as I held the bottle. What I was served was a cold glass of wine. It either not what he showed me or an opened bottle that was in The fridge. Somewhat disappointing. The satay presentation was good - but the chicken was chewy and lacked a proper seasoning. The service was very good.
Got the tuna ceviche, octopus and sea bass with prawn. Everything was excellent! Great service too. Would definitely recommend.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: It was exactly what we had hoped for!!! It was just beautiful and the food amazing!!! The receptionist was very sweet and accommodating!! My sister and I had delicious meals!! And desserts too. It was within walking distance from our RIAD. I DEFINITELY recommend this restaurant!!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;60+ Traveler

review_data.review: Great food! Great staff! Amazing service. And if you can’t be bothered to move from the longer you can have lunch boxes served right to the beach or the pool.

review_data.review_title: Top flight Korean with that Michelin flair
review_data.review: The food was phenomenal, and the service was excellent. Some of the descriptions of the food, spices, and inspirations for the dishes were a little unfamiliar coming from a Korean influence, but the food definitely gives a sense of place. Each dish was flawless, although the Mackerel dish was a little too fishy for our taste. (Our mistake for never having had Mackerel before.) The Octopus was delicious; tender and perfect. The Bossam (pork belly rice) was beautifully porky without being greasy. The Sea Bream was delicate and flavorful. I would recommend the Galbi (pork ribs), but you can also have them on W 32nd probably just as good but not on such a pretty plate. The desserts were works of art that were as tasty as they were beautiful. The Jang Dok were little kimchi pots made of ganache which was a nice way for the chef to tell his story. Likewise for the Harubang, by far the prettiest plate. I wish there was a little bit more light so we could have enjoyed the beauty of these plates. Wine list is excellent. The service was spot-on and polished, although a little reserved. We were able to warm up our servers a little by asking some questions and they showed some personality.

We were looking for some tapas and found this place on TA, I called to book and shutters were partially down, I called under in my best Bonjour, one of the brothers who own the restaurant invited me in and took the booking, we had a wonderful selection of tapas and wine, it’s quite small so it is best to pre book, the staff are very helpful and explain the menu and options very well, definitely worth a visit if you like tapas.

Great food and Atmosphere! We came as so many good reviews. It lived up to our expectations and more. The food was delicious , staff friendly goid service and the live music was soooo good! What a great evening! We shall be back ! Thank you !
Cosy restaurant and very nice service and staff! The choice was not so many and some was sold out ! The quality is good but the portions a bit small ! We were satisfied

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Reservation, service and location is top for a good high level dining ! We went for pomegranate salad sherbet and Shah pilaff! It was amazing and tasty and 110% worth ! The chief coming personally to ask about quality ! We would book again for a nice dinner anytime

review_data.review_title: Ideal if staying at the hotel or the sister properties opposite.
review_data.review: The restaurant offers Thai and western meal choices throughout the day.The staff are pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable.

I've been to this Parrilla twice and was very pleased both times. The atmosphere is average but the food is good. I had "Pollo a la Parilla" with grilled vegetables and it was delicious. The service was also great at this restaurant and the food came out pretty quickly. The last time I went to La Dorita I went with a friend and our bill came to about 180.00 pesos - certainly not cheap but neither was it expensive for Buenos Aires standards. I definitely recommend!
Nice restaurant in rawai to eat french food and good cuisine cooked by a french chef. On Tuesday they have a burger party, all you can eat burgers. Staff is nice and friendly.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nightlife Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Best homemade foie gras in Patong
review_data.review: The café de Paris restaurant is open again in Patong. They have the best homemade foie gras in Phuket. Made by Alain the french chef. The beef tartare is also very good.

review_data.review_title: Very good Australian stirloin in patong
review_data.review: Very good restaurant for meat, duck or burger with australian meat. The Australian stirloin is great. Friendly staff. The chef is very professional and welcoming. Prices are net, all included and located on beach road.

review_data.review_title: Alain the best chef in patong
review_data.review: They had a gigot d'agneau party. Amazing food. Very good gratin dauphinois. Dessert was great too, cheese cake. Don't miss this restaurant in patong.

review_data.review_title: Still the best french restaurant in Patong!
review_data.review: Back at the Café de Paris, still the best french food in patong.  Alain the French Chef makes sure that the customers are happy and enjoy his food.  I recommend the foie gras of course, the duck, and the desserts, friendly staff, give it a try!

The best restaurant in Patong, don't look anywhere else, the food is fantastic.  I enjoy good food and i can tell you that this place is the best in patong thanks to Chef Alain who is passionate about food, cooking and making his customers happy! And Georges makes sure everything is going ok during your meal.  We had homemade foie gras, delicious, duck with pinot noir sauce, very very good, panna cotta, so good and homemade too!!  They gave us some complimentary homemade macarons, very good too, everything was good.  Chef Alain is amazing and makes everything himself!  Don't miss this restaurant if you are in Patong, amazing food to eat and delicious desserts!
Professional and friendly staff at zen eat. The chef makes very good food and desserts. If you like burgers, don't miss the burger party on Tuesdays.

We had a great christmas dinner there, thank you to the owner and his staff to deal with all the customers at the same time.  Good food, great pumpkin soup and caramal ice cream. :)  If i may suggest, would be nice to have air conditioning inside and close the front window doors as it gets hot inside.  Recommend.

It has been 10 years since my last visit to Buenos Aires and Casa Saltshaker was on my must do list. It was just as much an incredible experience as I remembered in my previous three visits. Each time I have been I have really enjoyed visiting with other guests from around the world. Even though I am not the most social person, I have felt very comfortable with this experience. Dan and Henry make everyone feel at home. The food is superb and the wine pairings are excellent. In addition it is a great place to share your current travel experiences and obtain excellent advice and recommendations.

I am giving this 4 stars because of the wonderful service. However in my experience the food was disappointing. This trip I am trying to eat a bit healthier ordering vegetable plates along with steak. The vegetables were overcooked and visually unappealing. The salad I ordered was drenched with way too much salad dressing. When I arrived the restaurant was empty but when leaving it was full.
On an 11 day trip I tried many parillas. Food and service were very good and I was able to walk here from my hotel near the Oblisque. Prices reasonable.
Enjoyed petting their friendly cats. Had a delicious coffee ice mountain. Huge portion large enough to share. Super friendly staff.
Wonderful. Lemon grass is used for a very unique straw for drinks. Food and service are excellent. Delicious soup and roasted eggplant with pork. Can’t wait to return to try other dishes.

Lots of really good restaurants on Tapul road and this is one of them. Great prices, selection and quality, I had the chicken cordon bleu and it was delicious. Huge portion and great value. Service is excellent

We went to a few Instagram Hotspots before and got not really satisfied with the food. We decided to try this place out because it was nearby our riad.  It turned out very well, we had the best couscous here! The stuff was very friendly and helping as well. We would definitely recommend this over all the bad food on the market next to it.  Great job guys!!

review_data.review_title: Try it! Excellent food and great prices
review_data.review: We dined here 4 times during our stay in Siem Reap. Especially loved their Lok Lak, Khmer curry and cool fresh fruit shakes. The servings were generous, authentic dishes, service with a smile, always friendly and fast. Great atmosphere, cooling with fans and cheap Cambodian draf beers. Highly recommended for Khmer food with very reasonable prices - felt like we were robbing them!!!

review_data.review_title: Great for drinks and finger food
review_data.review: Great atmosphere, tasty cocktails , friendly service , casual design, amazing spring rolls. But I wish the menu were bigger - it’s more like a tapas bar than a restaurant.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Great simple place for lunch at the Siem Rip city center - tasty , quick , not expensive but the most important- the personally , hospitality and smile of the owner !!!
Simply great place - elegant eclectic design , nice service , phenomenal cocktails , delicious food and amazing live music with 3 singers !!!

review_data.review_title: Very good; pity it has not Italian sphere
review_data.review: Nice restaurant! Nice menu, nice location, decoration. Service is fast. Waiters are Ok but neither Portuguese-speaking nor Italians, which does not help the sphere. Clients are a mix of locals and tourists. But food was quite good... And I go to a restaurant to eat. I will definitely come back!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Apart from the location, the food was horrible.  Being from an Asian background, I feel other communities are blinded by this place as it does not offer the best ethnic taste. Our food was over cooked and the veg dish ordered was tasteless. We did speak to the lady about this and she was adamant that this is how the dish is made. Most of the food went back full but no good will gesture was offered knowing that we didn't eat it.  I am still talking about this place because it is by far the worst place I've eaten at. I would also like to add that when we left the restaurant, the chef came out and was quite inappropriate waving and calling us back in let's just say not in a professional capacity. Perhaps females need to not visit alone.  I am shocked how many good reviews this place has.

user_data.user_tags: Vegetarian;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: The mixed grill and the adana kebab were OK though the chicken breast was dry and tough. Pleasant enough but underwhelming as a whole. Could have been better if I had lessen my expectations.

We were given complimentary mezes and bread to start. Service was attentive. We ordered a kofte and an Adana kebab with a Greek salad and garlic bread. Both the meat courses were delicious. Unfortunately we could not sample the desserts as we had too much to eat. The complimentary apple tea after the meal was a godsend. Recommended for good honest cooking.

review_data.review_title: Best meal we had in Siem Reap!
review_data.review: Beautiful people and staff, if you eat out in Siem Reap you must go here but make sure you book! The food is AMAZING and you are supporting a wonderful small enterprise which helps train young people in cooking and helps to give them a wonderful start to a career which if not for Haven, they may never have that chance...

review_data.review_title: Wonderful meal on our first night in Vietnam!
review_data.review: Food is amazing, best spring rolls I've eaten! House wine is also good! Our waitress Van An was very helpful, attentive and friendly! Were going back for our second visit tonight!!

A very small restaurant within a short distance to the Place Jemaa El Fena. It is not easy to find inspite on the mail road. It opens at 1.00pm and closes 10.00pm. It is closed on Wednesday. There were two small tables on the ground floor with the main open kitchen behind them. On the first floor there were10 small tables for 4 people each.  Be prepared to wait a while as the food is freshly prepared. It is worth the wait as the food is delicious. I have been there on two occasions and on both time there was only one waitress who spoke very good English and was rushed off her feet. The local dish which I chose called Tajine was lovely. I chose a Tajine chicken which had fresh vegetables - runner beans, potatoes, carrots, olives (photo enclosed). This was my first Moroccan dish and I was not disappointed.  On the second time I had a freshly made pizza and it was just as enjoyable as the traditional Moroccan dish. Everything on it was fresh and it tasted wonderful. It tasted better than the ones that I had in Rome and Sicily.  This little restaurant gets very busy. I would highly recommend going early as possible otherwise there can be an hour waiting time. Diners do seem to be in a hurry to leave.  You will not be disappointed as it is a great place to enjoy home cooking at a very reasonable price.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: Having myself lived in Italy and consumed a fair amount of pizzas, I can honestly say that this is a true Neapolitan style pizza - and a great one indeed. I will be coming back, I can only recommend this place.

Located in Quartier Latin this restaurant has one feature that all good restaurants in Paris have: small tables and limited space. However, it is great what they serve! We had antipasti and pizza. Both was great. Service was friendly and competent. For sure we will come back.

No visit in Paris without eating in this restaurant. The 3rd time in 3 years and always delicious. Roland and his Team can keep the high quality level and you will always be more than satisfied. Looking forward to the next visit.

We visited here in October 2022. The selection of international and traditional dishes was great, I had the soup to start, and the rendang curry for mains, for mains my hubby had steak and we shared a bottle of wine. I have to say it was one of the best meals I've had in Ubud and would highly recommend! It was dark when we arrived so, unfortunately, the view was limited but if you were to go in the day it would be quite something!

We visited here in October 2022 the food was excellent as were the staff, very tentative and the signer was very good too! It wasn't the cheapest of meals but we were both very happy with the food and would go back in a heartbeat!
Fabulous first time @Sette Italian With family and friends, will definitely be back. Lovely setting upstairs on the Top floor

review_data.review_title: Fabulous again with Karam at the Kinara lake view
review_data.review: Fabulous meal again at Kinara at JA lake view. We have been before and brought friends this time and the food was absolutely amazing.

review_data.review_title: A Unique Dining Experience - come ready to eat!
review_data.review: We found via tripadvisor and showed up. It's an assuming black apartment door that leads up to a beautiful loft  Caters to tourists - but the group was 24 people from Australia, Brazil, US, Canada and Europe  5 course meal of amazing meats each paired with Wine - with great staff and an intimate / closed door feel. I've never had such a cool and unique dining experience in another country!  Luis is onsite and he and his staff make it feel like a big family dinner.  Would HIGHLY recommend. Go hungry - there is SO much food!

Loved the atmosphere. Service here is outstanding. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Special thanks to K.Rainy, K.Jiji, K.Nam and K.Ann for taking good care of us. Great quality of food. Andaman Seafood Platter is highly recommended. So fresh and delicious - it was served with a sizzling Himalayan salt brick which made the food taste even better! Wagyu rib-eye was great too but we ordered medium-well, it turned out rare and bloody but truffle sauce really goes so well with it. The restaurant is located inside Anantara Mai Khao Villas so the price is sure to be expensive, but it is worth to spoil yourself once in a while.

review_data.review_title: Really nice food, but was the steak as ordered?
review_data.review: Had a team meal here, so we picked from a menu beforehand. I had steak for the main, which was ordered Rare, but seemed to come Medium, although it was really nice, and perhaps came like that because it was Halal?  No complaints otherwise, and the staff were fun and friendly.

review_data.review_title: We went to watch the soccer game
review_data.review: We went to watch a soccer game... we booked our table in advance, the staff are great and verry professional the location is good as well... close to our hotel, the food was yumi we choose the tapas menu with a botlle of wine included...great vibe after the game we loved it... wish we had a place like this in Rabat :) next time in marrakech we will come back for sure!

review_data.review_title: High level of quality and taste
review_data.review: We have spent already couple of days in Prague, exploring different restaurants. This one so far is the best. The service, food quality and presentation are far better that the ones we tried with no exemption. Price wise the restaurant is offering amazing value for money (four people with full menu each - salad, main course and desert for below 2500 k). Real hidden gem outside the downtown. So it is worth every step of your going to this place!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: What a nice surprise. Our expectations were not high , it was a little out of our way and the restaurant looked small an not busy. But inside it opens into a bigger room. From we were met with a smile and a nice table and saw the menue we were sold. They make a nice shared platter with appetisers, excellent tasty . The main courses were superb , and the Lebanese wines ..and you wouldn’t be ruined when you get the bill . The evening couldn’t be better.

Had wanted to come here for ages. The place has a lovely vibe and great decor. There is additional seating downstairs which is where we sat. We ordered a host of Indian tapas - all of which were decent but the chicken masala wings were my fave. Though i would say the food is alright, the service is absolutely outstanding! Such friendly waiting staff and they offer you a complimentary Bailey's or Brandy after your meal.

Stopped in for a dinner with our 3 kids last night. Even though they were busy, they found our family a table and we were looked after by the wonderful Samui. The food we ordered was fresh and tasty. The seafood was a little chewy, but it was still good and edible. We enjoyed talking to Samui about her life and university studies. It gave our family an insight in to Khmer culture and way of living. The restaurant has a great vibe and is well priced. Would return if we are in Siem Reap again.

Much like its sister restaurant around the corner, this place is also an authentic Sicilian restaurant. A bit bigger than its sister but still crowded with a happy atmosphere. A loud music played in the background and everybody are happy. The food is fresh and tasteful and prices are very reasonable. Service was excellent. As pescatarians, we had many food choices. A vegetarian can also find starters and mains he or she can have. Great place, highly recommended.

We booed after reading the good reviews on TripAdvisor. We weren’t disappointed. The place is a bit old fashioned. The main place is not too big but it has additional space at the back and maybe upstairs. The gentleman who served us was very kind. He spoke with us from time to time and made us feel welcome. We took the tasting menu, which was excellent. We needed some adjustments with the food, which wasn’t a problem. The food and deserts were delicious. Together with a very nice bottle of Burgundy, we paid 240 Euros for two people. We will return!

review_data.review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review_data.review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

review_data.review_title: Fab cocktails in a nice garden setting
review_data.review: The cocktails at Wild are really fab. They don’t do dinner as such but have many different types of spring rolls. So, it’s like tapas. We ordered 5 lots of different spring rolls between the 2 of us and found that to be enough for dinner. We also tried 3 different cocktails, all of which were good. The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.

review_data.review_title: Mostly good but room for improvement
review_data.review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.

review_data.review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review_data.review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

review_data.review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review_data.review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_data.review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review_data.review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

review_data.review_title: Reasonably priced food in a beautiful garden setting
review_data.review: The price of the food was reasonable considering the beautiful setting of the restaurant. $10.50 for 2 meals and a drink. We were served fairly quickly and the service was friendly. I would definitely visit again.

review_data.review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review_data.review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.

review_data.review_title: Fantastic.. if money is no object
review_data.review: The food and service were both superb and I cannot criticise the craft of the chef and the attention of the staff. But, this is very expensive - it will set you back €300 for dinner including wine for 2 people. Worth a visit if you can afford it.

We had an amazing experience! Was looking for a good pizza in Seminyak, and this one answered all my questions. Good and friendly service as well, pleasant live music, not too loud to the point where we can’t carry on conversations. Everything was good. Ended with a nice tiramisu, shared and approved by everyone on the table. Will come back for more.

We had a wonderful experience! Traditional Japanese food with Japanese chef - totally authentic! Service was excellent by our waitress Janine, made us feel absolutely comfortable and took great care of us. We went for the a la carte sushi menu, and had the Takumi Platter for two: salmon, tuna, eel, snow crab, yellowtail, shrimp, salmon roe… everything you can dream about. Additionally, we have a Snow Crab Roll, which was really good, and a delicious Scallops Sashimi - super recommended. A must go for any authentic Japanese food lover!
Staff, food, menu choices exceptional. Music nice but a little loud. Small, chic, will return. Sole and sea bass were exceptional!

review_data.review_title: A place to remind for future trips
review_data.review: Menu is surprisingly well presented and with a good choice. Wine properly suggested with dishes and Sancerre rouge was great. Good service and prices correct.
We went to this restaurant so my husband could watch a specific football game one evening, the food was good and staff were good. It was just very quiet in there and lacked an atmosphere.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nightlife Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Just wanted to thank the staff for their amazing efforts and help for when my boyfriend got ill and dizzy from having overheated under Cambodian sun! We so looked forward to dinner, which was interrupted cos of nausea, I managed to eat one plate sadly my boyfriend didnt feel better so we had to rush home the staff kindly cancelled rest of dinner as well as helped call a tuk tuk!! the food was great, at least the one dish I did have, I would love to return to this great place, we sat on the rooftop overlooking siem reap!!

Ruba never disappoints. They have one of the best service in town and that combined with a plush interior and a very relaxed atmosphere, this has to be one of the best places near London Bridge. We have been here often, in the past, and the standard of service has never deteriorated. They have a wide range of cocktails on offer, and would be going back soon. Definitely recommend it.

Just as the review says: they are OK. Definitely wouldn’t wait in line again for these, honestly. We got one of each taco & a carne asada quesadilla. They all tasted similar. Extra sauces out of the bowls were bland & the guac was also bland.

user_data.user_tags: Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker;Nature Lover

review_data.review: This is a very tidy, clean and well run restaurant. The staff are attentive, the service is efficient and the food delicious. My friends and I have been there twice and had a variety of dishes all of which were great.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.
