review_data.review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.

review_data.review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review_data.review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

review_data.review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review_data.review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_data.review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review_data.review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.

review_data.review_title: Reasonably priced food in a beautiful garden setting
review_data.review: The price of the food was reasonable considering the beautiful setting of the restaurant. $10.50 for 2 meals and a drink. We were served fairly quickly and the service was friendly. I would definitely visit again.

review_data.review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review_data.review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.

review_data.review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review_data.review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

A very nice restaurant with excellent food. Very well prepared and presented using local produce and based on Khmer tradition with a modern interpretation. The option to eat in or outdoor is a bonus given the climate.

review_data.review_title: Best spring rolls I ate for a long time
review_data.review: We visited this beautiful bar which serves springrolls only for food. Finger food for share. It is located behind the night market. Better reserve a place. Spring rolls are fresh or fried. We ate fresh spring rolls with the filling of Sezar sald. And fried rolls with caramalized duck, taco and cheese and bazil filling. Cocktails are also very good. Enjoy

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Very quiet evening when we visited - just one guy serving but it seemed like many people were getting takeout. Calm, relaxing atmosphere and food was good (just not as excellent as expected given high reviews.) Really good value for money.

user_data.user_tags: Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: This was the best dinner we had in Prague! Even though the place is small it manages to be cosy and relaxed rather than cramped. The wine & food were amazing - following the recommendations of staff we found several wines we absolutely loved. Service was friendly. Really recommend booking here if you visit Prague.

Have been to Takieng a few times (or ordered from their menu at the Sandbox bar below) over the years but after a disappointing dinner a couple of months ago, tired it again. Unfortunately still disappointing.  Last time: calamari tasted like shoe leather. Tough. I was told "those are European calamari, not same as Thai"... ?!  This time: Pad Thai came out almost instantly. It was cold, the tamarind sauce tasted "off" (sort of like a fermented or blue cheese flavor which doesn't belong). I wasn't in the mood to complain.  I have not had a dish here lately which I would describe as "memorable".  This restaurant should provide a memorable dining experience to guests and visitors. It's a Thai themed restaurant so for sure it should get thai food right.  For some reason, Sandbox's kitchen puts out consistently well tasting dishes but clearly Takieng is struggling and not exactly in the inexpensive side.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: Myself and hubby went in last night to try get a table after phoning them but no answer. We were in luck we got a table. It didn't disappoint. The guys who work there are amazing. Friendly relaxed atmosphere. Felt very at home. Food was amazing. We were told it a relaxed experience but the server. He advised order two / dishes as like large tapas style served with wine. We can order more if wanted . He topped water up all the time. Could easily spend alot of time here. Infact booked to return tonight. AMAZING !

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: The tastiest food we have eaten in Morocco in the five days we have been here.Pleasant staff ,good service and fair prices,would recommend to give it a try

We visited Haven twice in our 4 nights in Siem Reap. After our first visit I was determined to go again because not only was our meal delicious but I felt we were supporting such a great cause. It was totally moving to see some of the more experienced staff literally ‘teaching’ some of the newer members of the team how to serve; open wine; take an order etc. The atmosphere was outstanding too and Sara was on duty one night and Paul the other night so we had the opportunity to speak to both of them. What impressive people and what amazing opportunities they are giving young people in Cambodia. We were so impressed. We also loved the food especially the red Khmer curry and the satay. Speaking to Sara moved us greatly as she explained how Haven came to be. We are both teachers so really could see and understand the fundamental change Haven was offering these lovely young people. Thank you so much Haven for being there and so glad we could be a small part of it,

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: The food: cooked on a salt block from Pakistan the fish or meats. I had the snapper which was beautifully cooked and presented. Location with a view of the ocean is breathtaking. Get there at least 30 minutes before sunset to enjoy the view of the water. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor they do have fans and cover from the rain. Or, have a drink at the bar - good view also of the sea and yummy drinks (I had Fire on Ice...rum delicious!) Ask them to give you a buggy ride on the grounds at night...the lighting is not to be missed. It’s a beautiful resort. Tip: they have a Tree House bar. We didn’t have time to get this is but looks really cool. You can walk over from the Marriott via the beach or take a buggy. Can be a bit hard to find from the road especially. Hope you enjoy this evening. Only drawback is the service (i.e. presenting the menu) is not good. Probably not comfortable with their English. Otherwise it’s just fine!
this was a good experience, tasty food, great service, reasonable pricing. outstanding opportunity to meet friends or just visit and enjoy culinary

My family of 4 (two children under 10) visited this restaurant based on hotel recommendation. The food is amazing, the prices are great, and the staff are friendly. We loved it so much I think we ended up eating here 3 times on our trip. Good luck only coming once!
Had coffees and desserts on a quick stop while cruising Patong. Real coffee! The hotel looks nice too. I will consider a couple of nights on my next trip to Phuket.

Took D&N as a second option for lunch, but it was rewarding. It is well located near the tourist area of Phuket Town.  Every dish was a masterpiece and well presented;  Phuket Beef Stew Braised Pork in Brown Sauce Salmon Ceviche Hokkaido Scallop with Thai Style with Garlic Chilli 2X Kombucha Cocktails 2X Smoothies Fruit Punch  It was so good we're going back for dinner tonight (next day)

review_data.review_title: HOLIDAY VERSION OF DINNER IS DELICIOUS BUT NOT INTIMATE
review_data.review: We attended the dinner in mid-December when the experience shifted from a "house" environment to a larger facility which could accommodate more people (to support the holiday demand). We don't know what the "house" is like except through reviews, but the "holiday" version is in a first floor restaurant-like commercial space that did not convey "house." It was modern, clean and well lit for sure, but it holds 25 people so that's quite a crowd. On our particular night, half of the crowd was a group that already knew each other so they sat together on one half of the long communal table. They didn't really mingle as, well, they didn't have to. So there was less over-all mingling than we were hoping for. That said, the non-group people around us were delightful, engaged and pleasantly interactive (folks were from all over the world). The food itself, however, was AMAZING, the best or near best meal of our 12 day trip to Argentina. Luis is a bit soft spoken but he gives a nice introduction about the elements of a "proper asado" before he fires up the grills and then another member of his team, a highly fluent (in english) young man who is well versed not only in food but politics and culture, acts as host and service captain. Every course is outstanding. The wine pairings well chosen, and the pours generous. Luis circulates a bit as things progress, which is nice. By 11pm when the dinner ended, the lack of intimacy had softed a bit due to the otherwise happy experience. If you are travelling during the winter holidays, check the website or inqure to see if they are doing this larger group thing again. Don't for an instant hesitate based on food/wine/service alone.

review_data.review_title: I would love to go back..........
review_data.review: We had an excellent meal here just before our Broadway play (Wicked). This is fine dining! But we appreciated the fact that they were very accommodating for our 10-Year-Old's as well as the adults. Our starter was calamari, which was excellent, along with the homemade tomato bread and breadsticks (popular with the kids). He had Cioppino, which was good; and the boys got Ziti with meat sauce and plain buttered noodles (I told you they were accommodating!); but it was my lobster raviolis with pink champagne sauce that stole the show. Excellent wine, excellent service, excellent food = very fine dining. (Or as the boys are telling me, very fancy!).

review_data.review_title: Great food with the best service.
review_data.review: Big, big thank you to Cloud Nine restaurant. The food is fabulous. Great variety to choose from on the menu and perfectly cooked and presented. Thank you to Nghia whose service is just the best. And all the rest of the team who do everything possible to please and give you the best dining experience, nothing is too much trouble in this Restaurant. The style, decoration and prices are second to none. Whether it be for lunch or dinner you must give this place a try. Highly recomended.

When you only have 3 nights in NYC, you want your choices to be really good. I choose Patsy's based on other Trip Advisor reviews, and its long history. My wife and I were seated in the back of the restaurant right up against the dessert tray! We both started with a Manhattan.Turned out to be the best thing of the night. Shared a caesar salad that had this "Sweet" strange dressing.Not a hint of an anchovy. Our waiter recommended a pasta(I can't remember the name) that was watery, not much flavor. We each had a glass of the Super Tuscan wine that didn't have much going for it either. I guess our photo, won't be up on the wall....

review_data.review_title: Great place for a quick, fresh, flavorful lunch!
review_data.review: Stopped here for lunch during a recent PLI conference. I was looking for someplace close, quick, quiet, flavorful and relatively healthy. Utsav checked all of the boxes. It was a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. The lunch buffet had many fresh and flavorful selections. The service was prompt and friendly. The buffet was not inexpensive, but it was worth it not to have to hunt for another place to eat or to have to rush through lunch. I would gladly return the next time I am in NYC.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: We visited V Zatisi to celebrate s milestone birthday. I had the Czech tasting menu with wine pairings, and I highly recommend it. My spouse ordered a la carte and also took the wine pairings. Our meals were delicious, and the restaurant offered us some exceptional Czech wines. It was an excellent choice for our celebration!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Hands down the best fish I had in QT!
review_data.review: Went here for an early dinner and got a table outside on the dock. Beautiful lake views. Service was prompt and attentive. Unfortunately the kitchen didn't respond to my request to get the hollandaise sauce on the side though. The salmon was super tasty and cooked to perfection with a fresh addition of Fennel and radish as sides. I paired it with the pea/broccoli/mint/feta side. Equally delish. All in all a very nice dinner experience.

review_data.review_title: Taco Fail... I hope they just had a bad day!
review_data.review: Ok. I'm very spoiled living in LA. TexMex and Tacos are the best outside of Mexico there imo. When to Taco Medic for a quick lunch. Ordred the bowl. There were 3 people in front of me still I had to wait almost 30 minutes to get my food. I ordered a bowl which by now means looked like any other "bowl" I've had the last couple of years. This was a paper box with cabbage in the bottom and lots of dressing/sauce (?) and a few pieces of over salted fish on top. They seemed stressed out and there was all sorts of chaos with drinks not being restocked, the chef setting his timer for 2 hours instead of 2 minutes... I wanted to love this place based on all great reviews but I was terribly disappointed. Didn't even finish my meal.

review_data.review_title: LOVE the pizza. So far my favorite in NYC.
review_data.review: I'm a huge fan of thin crust NYC pizza and this is my favorite place I've been to. I say this with the caveat that I don't make it to Brooklyn often so I'm sure there's better out there, but this is pretty damn good and I always leave happy. Personal pies go for about $15 each and they have lots of options for toppings. It's a small restaurant so I'm not sure if it can accommodate a huge group, but for couples or friends it's a really great lunch spot. Highly recommend.

Stylish high view restaurant with an artistic interior and lively atmosphere. The menu is interesting and food beautifully presented. Cocktail menu is diverse and innovative. The service is very efficient
This is a good value pitta stop and the homemade lemonade packs a lunch! The fries are a tasty addition. Quick turnaround and cafe style seating onto the square
I just decided to give him 3 stars because I didn’t think it was anything spectacular in the smoothie. It was good but not a WOW factor and less for price $4 usd. You can get a draft beer for $0.50

Siem Reap is a foodie's paradise. There is no shortage of wonderful places to eat when you are visiting this city. But be sure to include this one in your list.  The meal is done as a set menu - everyone gets the same dinner (excepting allergies). So it makes it simple, with no choices to make. The toughest decision is whether to have the wine pairing (4 glasses), or not. Have it.  The 7-course meal is presented slowly, and beautifully. It takes about 2 to 3 hours to get though dinner, and each course is fairly small. So although it may sound like 7 dishes is a lot, it feels perfect.  The restaurant, operated by the Kimsan Twins (I don't think they are actually twins), is entirely staffed by women. The kitchen, clearly visible from the first floor dining room, shows the skilled chefs at work, and provides a show to watch between courses.  The set menu changes seasonally, but I suspect that every season is a winner.  Eat here.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Excellent Ramen in Upper East Side
review_data.review: We visited this noodle shop after a long day at the Met. Being ramen lovers, we have high expectations for our ramen, and we weren't disappointed. We're hard to please, after having some incredible ramens around the world. Although this shop makes primarily beef-based broths, they also have chicken broths, which we prefer.  They have a good Sake menu too, and a bar dedicated to this wonderful spirit.  They have bench seating, so be prepared to share your table.

We arrived at noon on Sunday and were the first ones there. Not for long, the restaurant filled up by 1 PM.  The service was prompt and professional. The food excellent. We ended our week in buenos Aires on a high note, and with minimum meat. My wife had the salmon and shrimp ravioli in Genovese sauce, a delicate white sauce. It may be the best ravioli we ever had. I ordered the lasagna boleonaise and it too was excellent. Portion sizes were generous and the price was moderate.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Good to have a Michelin star restaurant in the hotel
review_data.review: It was a wet and cold Monday evening in November and it was so nice to be able to come down from our room to a top class restaurant without having to face the elements outside. You could never accuse this venue of being cozy or intimate, it's too spacious for that but it's a very pleasant dining environment nevertheless. Our last visit had been on a Saturday night in May when we had been surprised at how many empty tables there were. This occasion a Monday night in November the reverse was true with most tables occupied, even early in the evening. Our service from Roald was excellent and we hope that he remembers his promise to ensure that we can have zucchini flowers stuffed with mozzarella on our next visit in January! Our food [ starters Italian cold meat platter and Burrata followed by lamb rack and lobster pasta] were very good although considering the price, I felt that bearing in mind the usual generosity of portions in this restaurant the lobster on my pasta was a bit thin on the ground. We look forward to returning once again at the end of January next year.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler

review_data.review: Lunch buffet was awesome with choices of from starters till main course. Didn't find any variety in desert. But food was very delicious. Quite a good place, Must visit restaurant for Indian food.

Food and ambiance was just divine. Staff were delightful and complimentary drink and small dish were very tasty. We are currently staying at this resort and will definitely be back. My husband said it was the best Massaman Curry he’s ever had. I had Southern Style chicken skewers which were also repeat worthy. Don’t forget the mango sticky rice for dessert!
Warm welcome, great salads and tajine, Yassine and team professionals, welcoming and friendly, aware of our every need, almost like homecooking! The kindest team, friendless cat, and excellent food!

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;Eco-tourist;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer

review_data.review: Very elegant and cozy place. Christmas decoration made this evening especially special but the excellent food is worth going there all year round of course. I had the 5 course tasting menu and now I get hungry just thinking about it.
I had the 5 course dinner and although on the higher side than other tasting menu restaurants it was well worth it. The service was excellent and my nice waiter helped me making the right choices.

I have tried a visit to this place, after reading the excellent reviews, on one of the not so frequent evenings I wanted a burger. The result was absolutely outstanding, not only because the excellent staff and a stroke of luck got me a table despite the fact that the place is normally quite crowded (a reservation is definitely a good idea, especially for more than two people), but because I discovered that, besides the several delicious burgers, this place serves equally tempting tartare steaks, which I am going to sample during my next visit, so more to come shortly.

I highly recommend this restaurant. Even though it is highly ranked on TA, we were able to get a table for three at dinner time immediately. Every dish we tried was incredible. One of us even teared up as she tried the creamy chicken curry. We also ordered the couscous and pastilla -- they were equally amazing. We're already planning on returning after for dinner after our desert tour.

This was the venue for the final evening of our tour of Vietnam and Cambodia and it was a fantastic choose by our travel company. The food was delicious and my husband even ate the crickets. The staff are delightful and make the whole experience even more enjoyable.

Came here while on holiday as it was close to where we stayed. Picked well food was good and tasty. We had 2 beers , water, one chicken pakora starter for hubby. He said it was fresh , most, chicken breast with a spicy sauce. Next one nan, one basmati rice, a chana masala side dish, a lamb pasanda and a mutter paneer. All very good, service swift and bill was 1300 Krona.

This is a nice relaxed area. Its never really busy. We had 2 cocktails , they were nice but overpriced. £13 for one £15 for the other and nearly £3 service charge. we had cocktails in other places which were just as nice for half the price.

Don't eat anything before a visit here. Book as if they have a party in it fills up quickly. Big burger, fries, we had 2 beers 2 dips and onion rings. Bill was 900 krona. Fast service tasty food. We had one burger with pear and blue cheese and a vegetarian one the same.

I was in La Dorita last Sunday, more or less one year after my previous visit. It was again a great experience. Not only the meat is great but also the portions are huge for my Brazilian standards. Our party of 6 ordered one salad, two chorizos, french fries, one entraña and one colita de cuadril (which in Brazil se call picanha). We ordered the colita because they did not have asado de tira which was our first option. All was accompanied by a penguin of malbec (they have 3 barrels of wine over the counter and fill half or one litter ceramic penguins to bring to the table). The meat and the chorizos were cooked to perfection. That is what a parrilla is about. We did not have problems with the service as mentioned in some comments. It was just correct. The bill including one shared ice cream with dulce de leche and service was AR$700, not bad at all. Go to La Dorita for great parrilladas...

This place is not good. The food is Bangladeshi rather than Indian. It’s also very bland for what should be really big bold flavours. We ordered a tikka masala and a vindaloo, both were very similar but should have tasted completely differently. It’s quite expensive compared to other restaurants in Prague.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Its grilled chicken Khmer style with mashed sweet potato goes down as one of my top 10 meals. Its owner, one of Cambodia’s top chefs, tries to promote real countryside cuisine based on recipes which have been passed down through generations. The result is a creative display of interesting stuff and a delicious feast of flavours. It gets extremely busy at night so I preferred lunches. Prices are very reasonable. Not to be missed. Try some of the very creative cocktails created using tradicional Cambodian stuff like local Whisky and palm sugar.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: This is a unique restaurant for its truly outstanding food and the chef behind it all, a national celebrity who trains aspiring chef. He himself was trained in Siem Reap and uses his grandmother’s recipes to create delicious dishes based on tradicional Cambodian food fused with South East Asian stuff. A absolutely adore the grilled chicken with the sweet potato and coconut milk mash, and the grilled rice balls/dumplings with chive. There are a lot of dishes for the more adventurous palate also, using local herbs and roots. All very very delicious indeed and very reasonably priced. On this trip to Siem Reap I visited 4 times in one week.

One of my best meals ever and a wonderful discovery. Food is reasonably priced, and very very good. I would say Michelin-star quality: very innovative, wonderfully presented and just extremely tasty. I loved the spicy chicken wings in a delicious curry sauce and the Cambodian grilled chicken served with a fabulous sweet potato and coconut mash. Shall return tomorrow. The chef is well known in the local circle and is highly regarded. Is something who will be around for a long time creating wonderful dishes.
Great food, great location and friendly staff! Everything was delicious and price range is the standard for siem reap!

Made it a point to visit this place after reading all the reviews about it! I was there on a quiet night and opted to sit on the upper floor so that I could have a good view of the street. There was a great selection of Western and local cuisine on the menu. I had the local lok lak since I have not tried it yet and ordered a shake as well. The shake is very cheap, at only US$1 and it is soooooo goooood! Food is not expensive either. I did not regret stepping into this place and wanted to visit it again but did not have another opportunity since my trip was a short one. But will definitely visit again if I ever go back to Siem Reap! Highly recommended for anyone visiting Siem Reap!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;History Buff

review_data.review: Having read many good reviews about this place, I decided to give it a try. It wasn't very hard to find and I went in to hide from the heating sun. There weren't many people when I was there but soon, the place filled up a bit. The couple were very welcoming the moment I stepped foot into the place and gave me a glass of cool water before I even ordered. I asked for a recommendation and the lady boss recommended and mango and passionfruit ice. I asked if it will be too big a bowl for me so she explained that I could opt for the smaller portion at US$1 lesser so I took that. While waiting for the ice, I was admiring the wall and pillars in the shop, which hundreds, if not thousands, of travelers have left notes on. The place was cosy and clean and definitely good for a breather from the heat. The ice came and I fell in love with it even from the first mouthful. The ice is not just pure ice but has condensed milk in it and it was really fragrant. The passionfruit sauce wasn't sour but has a mixture of sweetness in it as well. Perfect! Enough said!

We visited for dinner based on the other reviews here and they certainly weren't lying. There are so many scams and rip-offs around but this restaurant is bang on. Fair prices, friendly staff and delicious food.  There was a queue for entry when we were leaving I think that says it all, especially given its a little trickier to find. Well recommended if you're looking for great local food at a good price

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: We had a wonderful evening with good food, wine & people. Chef Luis served a huge piece of bife the chorizo which was tasty but not the best steak we had in Argentina. The host were very friendly, entertaining and did great service. We felt as we would have a typicial asado at argentinian friends home. Would recommend this place to experience a good asado!

We adored Grand Cru. My husband found it researching Prague and we were so happy he did! We went for lunch. Showed up a little late (probably around 2pm) but they didn't mind at all and served us with a smile. We got the two-course lunch menu but got an amuse-bouche to start and Petit fours to finish. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable and willing to chat about the food, wine, and city. Would highly recommend to anyone going to Prague - a great break from all the heavy Czech food.

I came here with my husband for his birthday dinner as he was really excited to try the asado. I am a vegetarian and came here knowing it would not be as exciting for me as him. However, I was a bit disappointed in what I got. My main course was a risotto, which I found strange. Why not grilled vegetables instead? I would have loved to have something grilled as well. My husband said his steak was just ok and not as good as he thought, he came with very high expectations. That being said, our host was fantastic and very knowledgable! He went out of his way to make sure everyone was having a good time and well taken care of. We also enjoyed getting to talk to people in the family style sitting at dinner. We sat next to a lovely couple. Would recommend for those wanting an asado experience.

We visited this place during our stay in Prague as it was close to our hotel and because of good reviews. The experience was excellent. Food was really very good and the staff were excellent. Highly recommend anyone anyone who visits Prague goes to this please for a and ambience.

review_data.review_title: A lovely last evening in Buenos Aires
review_data.review: This was recommended to us by our BA guide. He listed it as in Palermo but it is really in Soho and quite a trek from our Palermo hotel – so we took a cab. It was in a part of this enormous city that we had not visited so it was great to see such a ‘buzz’ going on. The restaurant was quiet at 7.30 but filled up as the evening progressed. The food was pretty good but not mind blowing but at a reasonable cost and the waitresses that served us were a delight and very helpful.

Sometimes we found the Michelin star in France a question mark who they earn it but in this restaurant it is clear. The 9 course dinner was excellent and the Wagyu beef is wonderfull, when you taste you want to go back to Kyoto.. The crockery where the dishes are served match with it. Prthaps it is a idea to give the guest a menu when leaving but hte sweets and cake was also wonderfull.Thanks to the staff and sommelier for a nice evening.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: Magic place, very good food. A varied and gourmet offer of Italian and Maricchina cuisine. We had the pleasure of meeting the owner who told us some stories of the riad.

review_data.review_title: Simple but well cooked food with a smile
review_data.review: The tragic story of Tevy and her various projects and passions (local female artists and anti plastic crusade) are all over the walls of this little restaurant which gives it a unique and homely feel with a personal touch. The food is crazy cheap even by Cambodian standards while the portions are plentiful. Fish amok especially recommended, while the healthy and versatile juices/ shakes/smoothies were very nice too.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: We had a great lunch here, along with tasty shakes, with massive portion sizes in terms of the massaman curry, enough for two easily. The waitress was really sweet and attentive too.

We only came here because our Thai restaurant choice was closed. On entering the restaurant I had no idea what was behind the facade, which looks pretty ordinary, and said I wanted to eat inside. The waiter politely sugggested outside would be better and led me around the side of the building. I was really amazed, they have unique swing-mattress, bed like tables (though you can choose a normal table if you want) that make you feel like it is a high end restaurant in Marrakech (the last time I saw anything like this). So we were super comfortable and our toddler was in her element. The food was also great, the drinks wonderful and the prices, even with the 10% added at the end, crazy low given the ambience and environment. We will be back!
The service was excellent. The food range was varied. The quality of the dishes was excellent. The atmosphere is cosy and warm. The adult non alcoholic beverage range was limited and needs attention.
Food quality is ok. Young service team trying too hard to please tourist. Lack sincerity. Return: NO

Came here when in London last weekend and stopping around the corner.  Very impressed with the quality of the food for the price point given the location.  We had the tasting menu and matching wine flight over the course of about 4 hours.  A series of lovely “snacks” to get started and then into the actual menu. There wasn’t a bum note here, everything was superb but special mention goes to the scallop and smoked eel which was exceptional.  The wine flight was as good as I’ve had anywhere, great pairing and a lot of interesting choices of slightly less mainstream varieties and locations.  Service throughout was very good.  We will definitely return in the future.

Great food, excellent wine. Small place, 12 people can fit inside. But quality makes up for quantity of people. The food is really good, all dishes we tied were excellent. The wine choice is superb, wines from Puglia, great advice, I was very happy with all suggestions. Excellent place to visit in Prague!

review_data.review_title: Amazing menu in a romantic setting
review_data.review: My wife wanted to celebrate her birthday here because of the romantic setting. Had to book ahead quite a bit, the process was great, as I asked for a birthday cake for my wife, I got a very fast response from the team there, we worked through what I wanted, and 48 hours before the dinner I was asked to confirm again. The dinner was amazing, we had the ‘as time goes by’ menu, I loved everything, amazing taste experience. Service was outstanding, and the cake at the end both beautiful and delicious. My wife loved every minute, thank you to the team at pur!

chose to visit here knowing that the pizza and pasta were housemade and therefore no GF options available. however there were plenty of other options and i had a divine squid dish. great range of italian wines and the smells from the pizza oven were sensational!!!

Visited here with a group of teenage boys - no one was hungry afterwards! Ribs and steaks both very good, garlic sizzling mushrooms divine. Fairly pricey menu but on par with other similar establishments around the area.

To see the reviews on TripAdvisor, it is to believe that we have chosen the wrong restaurant!!  Dinner for two on the terrace. Vietnamese card: 3/4 choices only.  We took Nems to share and Bun cha (grilled pork and noodles) and cha ça (fish) in dishes plus a bottle of Chilean chardonnay wine.  Very nice waitress but not speaking a word of English and a beginner for sure! She introduces us to another Chilean Sauvignon wine. The domain name being the same she did not understand! We are then offered another chardonnay twice as expensive (1,250 ok) but it is not cold!! So ice cubes in the glass … (it does not matter we are on vacation)  Passable culinary quality. Big surprise ! We did not know that the accompaniments of the 3 dishes were identical.  When paying...nobody know how to debit an Amex card. Everything ends very well with a smile because they are kind staff.  This note is for the GM. Where is the management and staff training?  Fortunately all our other discoveries in Hanoi were fantastic
Bid slow to attend table. Not too busy for a Saturday. Sitting eating you do not see anything South African, only walking up the stairs. Burger nice flame grilled almost like Steers. Food tastefully.

user_data.user_tags: History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Excellent service during dinner time, nice window-views of the downtown city centre. Enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere
This restaurant is my new favorite restaurant in Istanbul. Excellent Food and service. Sermat, Ersil and Murat are exceptionally friendly, professional and caring.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: We took a table outside and were not disappointed. The space is comfortable, and green. Service was good. The wine/champagne selection could be improved and we found the prices a bit expensive compared to other places in Siem Reap. We liked the fact that they used lemongrass stems instead of plastic straws - very creative. Food was ok.

review_data.review_title: Great food, beautiful ambiance, exceptional service
review_data.review: We only stayed at La Siesta Trendy for two nights and on the first night in Vietnam we had to have the obligatory street food which was great. For the second night, and after a very long day of touring the city, we decided to have dinner at The Red Bean. Greeted by friendly staff at the lift door, we were ushered to an intimate table and offered a menu with a great selection of dishes and drinks including cocktails. For cocktails we had: The Naked Man Pina Colada Both very moorish, so we had seconds at the end of our meal! We would recommend the spring rolls platter which had two fresh rolls, two crispy seafood rolls and two crispy Hanoi pork rolls. This was followed by a beautifully presented steaming bowl of pho. The pho at the restaurant was a delicately flavoured broth with rice noodles and tender beef. It was different to the rustic flavours you’d get from street food vendors and equally as wonderful. Every pho recipe has some hidden secrets and this was evident in the subtlety different flavours. Mango sticky rice wrapped up the evening and the warm coconut flavoured rice with sweet mango was everything that I was expecting and looking forward to trying for the first time. It was a great restaurant choice for our last night in Hanoi and if we are ever here again we will definitely visit.

review_data.review_title: Very Attentive Staffs, Vegetarian food available
review_data.review: Very attentive staffs. Food including vegetarian food was really good. My wife did not like the fish soup, but it may be her personal dislike. Overall, highly recommended to enjoy your food.

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: We stayed at The Kayon and after eating dinner here on the first night, we were so impressed with the food quality and service that we ate most of our meals here! The menu is large and everything we ate, whether western, Indian or Indonesian was so delicious and presented beautifully! The staff were very attentive and friendly, we enjoyed having conversations with them each day. We recommend this restaurant to anyone staying in Ubud.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Nature Lover;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: First of all i have to say that the food was really good and tasty and the service was great. But the restaurant is really small!!!! And they have placed one table right next to the other. It is really difficult to feel comfortable. We had booked for 4 people and i thanked God that we were a family with 2 kids.

A very cozy french bistro. The service was superb. The food excellent (maybe here i ate the most tender beef in my entire life). They also prepared for our kids a wonderful plate especially for them (well grilled chicken with potato puree) Maybe of the extreme high quality of food i was a little bit disappointed with the desserts (especially pavlova). That's why i don't give 5 stars

I’ve been multiple times at the place. I think I had the complete menu already. Bagels are absolutely stunning. They’re all full of flavor and have top notch ingredients. And when you’re not hungry, just take a coffee. It’s the real deal. Staff is super friendly. They always stop by to see if all is ok. Whatever you ask, they’ll do it for you. I certainly go back soon.

A little bit of Italy right here in Queenstown! The food was very authentic - homemade pasta and gnocchi- what more can you ask for? Panna cotta to die for, that’s what! The service was excellent and would highly recommend if you’re in Queenstown.
Disappointed that the salt sommelier turned out to be a boy with lots of salt in jars! He didn't really care whether we liked his recommendations or not, we got what we were given

review_data.review_title: Tasty food at very reasonable prices
review_data.review: This was one of the most value-for-money dinner we had in our 7 day stay. Almost everything we ordered was good. Fried spring rolls, morning glory, amok were our all time favourites in almost all restaurants, and Try Me did not disappoint us on these. Portions of rice that came were huge. The lemon mint lemonade and Khmer pumpkin sago dessert was especially notable. For all 5 of us, the total bill came up to just $21 with drinks.  Both bathrooms ran out of water and had no water running from the taps. The WC flush still worked but not the taps at the basins. The staff filled up a pail with water for us to wash our hands instead. Apart from this, would recommend a visit.  If you are facing Caltex petrol kiosk (there is only one Caltex in Siem Reap), take the road on the left of Caltex. Keep going down this road and Try Me is there.

Great educational resource for Siam Reap. They are doing an excellent job. But, to me as a customer the food is what matters. And I have to say it was sensational- well presented, well balanced flavours. Yummy!!!Go there for a great meal, and help the student learn as well.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: Had a few nights in Queenstown recently. Our son recommended this bar, and he and his wife had twins (7 weeks early) the morning of our visit. I was a bit excited and anxious, and couldn’t help telling the lovely lady at the bar. She gave us a glass of Brancott Estate each, with congratulations. All the staff were great. We had a few more drinks and a wonderful platter. Great atmosphere. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED...

Came here last time in Queenstown (April 2019) and also gave it 5 stars. Nothing has changed. The bar has a really good feel and the staff all look like they love their jobs, very efficient and friendly. We had a couple of drinks each and a fabulous platter. Convenient location. Will probably go there again before we leave. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED..

I am giving this 4 stars because of the wonderful service. However in my experience the food was disappointing. This trip I am trying to eat a bit healthier ordering vegetable plates along with steak. The vegetables were overcooked and visually unappealing. The salad I ordered was drenched with way too much salad dressing. When I arrived the restaurant was empty but when leaving it was full.

It has been 10 years since my last visit to Buenos Aires and Casa Saltshaker was on my must do list. It was just as much an incredible experience as I remembered in my previous three visits. Each time I have been I have really enjoyed visiting with other guests from around the world. Even though I am not the most social person, I have felt very comfortable with this experience. Dan and Henry make everyone feel at home. The food is superb and the wine pairings are excellent. In addition it is a great place to share your current travel experiences and obtain excellent advice and recommendations.
On an 11 day trip I tried many parillas. Food and service were very good and I was able to walk here from my hotel near the Oblisque. Prices reasonable.
Enjoyed petting their friendly cats. Had a delicious coffee ice mountain. Huge portion large enough to share. Super friendly staff.
Wonderful. Lemon grass is used for a very unique straw for drinks. Food and service are excellent. Delicious soup and roasted eggplant with pork. Can’t wait to return to try other dishes.

Lots of really good restaurants on Tapul road and this is one of them. Great prices, selection and quality, I had the chicken cordon bleu and it was delicious. Huge portion and great value. Service is excellent

review_data.review_title: We walked the town and found this joint....
review_data.review: Reasons we loved this place.... 1. Food....all designed to share, we ordered 4 dishes for 2 and was plenty, was great quality, and very filling (note the food comes out as it’s done, don’t blow up if it doesn’t all come at same time!)  2. Beer, good tap beers, was shame no Pilsner but the pale ale was good  3. View.....outside, by the lake, can’t buy that view  4. Playlist... if you are a 50 something the songs all took us back to our mis-spent 20’s  5. Callum.....our waiter....what a legend. Friendly, funny, entertaining, helped us around the menu, made our evening memorable! Restaurants need more Callum’s !!  Highly recommended!!

This is our 3rd location in New Zealand and we finally found a restaurant that appreciates flavorful dishes. This is a tapas style restaurant. We ordered the lamb montaditos, calamari and chorizo, and the daily salad. The lamb set atop some mint and bread with the heavenly smoked paprika was crazy good. The calamari, chorizo and potatoes had a wonderful flavor also. Also was looking for a nice green salad - like a Greek salad with olives, roasted tomatoes, cokes- perfectly satisfying.  Staff was very busy yet never ignored the customer's needs. Highly recommend! Maybe we'll revisit when we go to Christchurch!

Two menu options consisting of a starter of a choice, a main dish of a choice, and a fruit dessert. The place is colorful and lovely. It doesn’t look pretty at the entrance, though, but don’t get discouraged. Nice and professional staff. The only thing I’d change was the music :/ the covers of pop songs played there take the charm away, yet my friends loved it. To each their own ;) The food tasted GREAT and was served with mint tea and a big bottle of water included in the price.
Our second time at this restaurant and would totally recommend. Booking essential. I had the fillet steak and it was mouth watering.

If you are looking for a beautifully restored Riad for dinner in the middle of an interesting neighbourhood this is the place to go. The staff was particularly friendly and attentive. The food was excellent (especially the lamb shoulder). The atmosphere is great especially in the front room with life Morrocan traditional ( soft) music.

user_data.user_tags: Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Great Italian food, although you can also choose the Moroccan menu. The setting is very pleasant and altho tucked away the signs to find the restaurant make it easy. Service was good and the Riad atmospheric.

If you are looking for a beautifully restored Riad for dinner in the middle of an interesting neighbourhood this is the place to go. But this time, two years after my first visit, the staff seemed less attentive. Maybe because I was alone? The couscous was good but not as good as last time, a bit bland, where did the Moroccan spices gone: catering too much to too many international tourists? I hope my next visit will be better!

An excellent restaurant. The fish and the octopus, were outstanding, vegetables fresh and well presented and the service very good. We ate inside (reservations a must) but outside can be very pleasant depending on the weather. The waiter made good wine recommendations. All around a great experience and good value for money. Average per person was 40 euros including wine and full menu.

It’s the best place for dates, ladies nights of just having cocktails with friends. Amazing view on Burj Kalifa, open area but at the same time restaurant hold a normal temperature for guests, so we have: 1) pleasant atmosphere 2) view on town 3) sneaks like fresh fries with truffle souse, salmon sashimi and good quality cocktails big portions

a luxurious Indian restaurant is located in the hotel. we came for brunch and gorged ourselves on appetizers. a lot of food. we tried almost everything. If you want to try something new, tasty and unusual, then this is the right place for you. Also great bourbon cocktails. for dessert was Indian teramisu and much more. in short very tasty  роскошный индийский ресторан расположен в отеле. мы пришли на бранч и обьелись еще на закусках. очень много еды. мы попррбовали практически все. если вы хотите попробовать что то новое, вкусное и необычное, то вам точно сюда. еще классные коктейли с бурбоном. на десерт был индийский терамису и еще много всего. короче очень вкусно

Very pleasant place, fully booked on Friday, after 12 you won’t be able to talk due to club loud music like Macarena, 50 cent, 20’ hits, Arabic songs, but you can dance and hang out. Audience 32+. There are few Europeans, most local. Nice Italian vine. Stuff is very attentive, thanks to Ace

review_data.review_title: Excellent Indian restaurant close to Tufnell Park
review_data.review: Lived close by, and unfortunately I first tried it the last evening. By far the best indian food I got on this trip. There was a small hickup with the starter, I simply did not get it, and by I asked for it again, the main meal came, but I got a small beer as a compensation. Friendly staff. Even if I most likely will not live close to Tufnell Park on my next visit, I will take the tube, to visit the restaurant again, its very close to the station.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;History Buff;Thrifty Traveler

review_data.review: Ate here as part of my G Adventure tour in Cambodia. Food was good. The area is economically depressed however this place offers hope. It's good to give back.

Four of us had dinner after seeing a Broadway show. My daughter's friend, who works in the area recommended the restaurant and we were not disappointed. We ordered from the regular menu, rather than the price fixe menu. We had assorted dishes, such as Paneek Paneer, Sea Bass and veggie dishes. We ordered Garlic Naan and Jasmine Rice, which were extra. The food was very tasty. The sea bass was very small for the high price charged, but it was also very tasty. Living in New Jersey we found the prices very high, but knowing that we were in NY, it was expected. The restaurant is nicely decorated and is located in a courtyard between 46th and 47th Streets. The bar is on the ground floor and the dining area on the second floor.

Wow! We wanted somewhere special to celebrate our silver wedding, and Pur' certainly was special. This really is fine dining: exciting food in elegant surroundings, with highly professional front-of house staff. They were efficient, yet amiable, witty and completely put us at our ease. This was the most expensive meal we have ever had, but we don't regret that for one moment.

review_data.review_title: Shockingly impersonal hosts. Decent food, nothing really outstanding! Mediocre Wines.
review_data.review: We had an OK night at casa SaltShaker, but in the end it was a disappointmet, because we  expected MUCH more.  First of all, the food was ok - there's nothing to complain about. However, it wasn't anyting really special. This is definitely NOT world class, in a city famous for its abundance of world class restaurants. Of course, this insight was a disappointment!  The best way to describe what I mean is:  If I was invited to a hobby cook's house and he cooked such a meal, it would be great. If however somebody pretending to be a knowledgable chef invited me to his and cooked this menu for me, I would clearly think that he was not trying nearly as hard as he could, but was saving efforts...  The Casa Saltshaker guys are definitely to be attributed to the hobby cook area...the problem is that TA rates them in the other category (and they think that they belong there...)  The HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT was however was the complete abscence of any personal interaction on behalf of the "hosts". When you "invite" somebody into your home and you do not wish to exchange even a word with your "guests", this is really a bummer. I had the feeling that they were desperate to put us through the process as quickly as possible, collect our money and send us home.  I certainly didn't feel welcome there.  Exemplatory for the attitude towards their guest was this episode:  Coming in I was thirsty and aksed for a glass of water. They rejected it by saying that they would start serving dinner in 10min. REALLY!? Is THAT hospitality?! No one had ever before denied me a glass of water :-)  Making up for the desaster that our hosts were was a quite nice mix of guests with whom we've had a fun evening anyway, despite the hosts (unfortunately not because of them :-)  Last but not least, the wine "pairing" we had with the meal was mediocre. We have had wine pairings in good places in Buenos Aires, so we know what can be expected in this price range. The guys either don't have a clue about wine or they simply don't care (I suppose it's the latter, because it fits the overall picture).

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review_title: Might well be the best Indian in London
review_data.review: I recently moved to Archway and The Sitara was immediately suggested to me. Ended up going there soon after with a big group and judging by their impressions (one of them was a very good chef by profession) I am not wrong when I say the food is amazing. The host is an amazing guy and the service was splendid. Will go again!

Re'Tasco is so far away from the city centre that the owner told us that he always worries about no-shows when he gets bookings from tourists.  Well, we showed up, and we had a blast. The steak is incredible - this coming from someone who usually avoids steak (and beef in general), but the starter of cockles in garlicky broth was - if anything - even better.  They were a bit shorts on waiters, but the ones they had were great, and we got good advice on the wine selection too.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review_title: Perfect steaks. Friendly and personal service
review_data.review: We found this restaurant on TA and decided to give it a try. Upon arrival, the owner greeted us personally and explained everything. It turned out that he immigrated many years ago from Ukraine/Russia who initially studied something else but finally fulfilled his dream and opened a restaurant in Buenos Aires. The service and attitude couldn’t have been friendlier and more natural. We both decided to habe beef (of course) with grilled vegetables and papas fritas with garlic. The food was served fast and smoothly and it was just perfect. Altogether a great, high quality but also unpretentious dining experience for a very reasonable price.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review: This restaurant is located a little bit outside the centre of Prague but it’s well worth going there. The staff are friendly and can-do. There is a very good selection of great food and it’s presented in a very pleasant way. We did the wine pairing which seemed to have been a very good choice. Altogether a very pleasant evening.
Everything was great from the service to the food, really worth to stop by this restaurant if you are around Marais quartier

absolutely a fantastic little spot on a vast gastronomic map of Paris. Worth travelling to. Great, personable service, excellent English . Food was fantastic - turbot, veal steak, lamb - all absolutely amazing. And bread to die for :) . Highly, highly recommended. Realizing that it is easy to get lost amongst thousands of restaurants in Paris - you will not regret visiting this Bistrot :)

This is a lovely restaurant with a really interesting menu and beautiful tasting and presented food - we even received an amuse bouche. The waitresses are keen to explain the menu and meals - all using local authentic produce. The kitchen is open so you could see your food being freshly prepared and was immaculately clean. Definitely worth a visit.

In Queenstown we ordered this lamb as we read it was very good. It is!!!  Three out of our 5 was into lamb so one of their shoulders with potatos and a side of salad was plenty for us. Delivered still quite hot.  The lamb was very good- juicy, tasty, not over cooked. Much better then some of the restaurants we had tried. The potatoes and salad was also good.  Well recommended for any one who likes lamb.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Nature Lover

review_data.review: Wow, expensive yes, but you will never forget this three hour tasting pleasure. We chose three wine pairings to our seven courses and not only were the presented beautifully they tasted even better. Have never dined in a closed door restaraunt, but wish they would allow this in the states. Go dot not hesitate, as it is truly something "to write home about". Reservations in advance are a must, don't miss this rare gem.....

This was my first time an d what a treat. Feels very much like being in Greece, the sun helped, the white walls, the friendly feel, the great food and very attentive service. Really enjoyed the food and will definitely be back when I want a friendly, relaxed lunch in north London. Thank you. It was a lovely lunch.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review_title: Fun, yum and I hope doesn’t hurt bum
review_data.review: Great food and great staff. They also gave us free rinks love it, we had the taster menu (bloody lovely) would recommend to a friend/ (I don’t know you) enemy. Cum 💦 here x
very tasteful moroccan cuisine; come with an empty stomach! beautiful surrounding. I definitely recommend this restaurant

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Shopping Fanatic;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review_title: Nice and cheap, but we waited a lot
review_data.review: This place has very low prices and a very nice menu. It's easy to find, just follow your GPS. The restaurant is small, but colorful and welcoming, i liked it. Everything was tasty, very good to eat. The only problem was the waiting: there was only one waiter, so a lot of time passed between a serving and the other. Still appreciated the dinner

review_data.review_title: Wow!, you don't need to love Korean food to be blown away by this place
review_data.review: The food is simply off the charts! It's definitely a must stop for foodies with a menu full of creativity and a chef that is determined to showcase her skills. Her training as a pastry chef cannot be hidden, but all of the food was impressive. The food is artistic, colorful, and prefectly prepared. The service is also impeccable.  There is a reason the octopus stays on the menu. It's amongst the best preparation for octopus that I've ever had.  A clear winner for this Michelin 2 star.

This was our first night in Harlem and we just wanted something easy (i.e. no cooking). Looking online showed this as a good place to eat but by the time came to going out, we were too tired so decided on takeaway instead. As we were walking balk from the liquor store, we called in to ask abouy delivery and had a very friendly encounter - delivery would take an hour but we could collect them in 20 mins !! Perfect.  9 pizzas ordered and collected at the 20 min mark and they were all excellent. The calzone (in particular) was wonderful and the spicy Italian sausage simply excellent. There was very little left at the end of the meal.  Price wise, not the cheapest BUT this is not normal takeaway quality.  Would we go back - yes (probably on Thursday evening) Would we recommend to others - absolutely yes!

Very pleasant place, fully booked on Friday, after 12 you won’t be able to talk due to club loud music like Macarena, 50 cent, 20’ hits, Arabic songs, but you can dance and hang out. Audience 32+. There are few Europeans, most local. Nice Italian vine. Stuff is very attentive, thanks to Ace

If you want to try something new, tasty and unusual, then this is the right place for you. Also great bourbon cocktails. for dessert was Indian teramisu and much more. in short very tasty  роскошный индийский ресторан расположен в отеле. мы пришли на бранч и обьелись еще на закусках. очень много еды. мы попррбовали практически все. если вы хотите попробовать что то новое, вкусное и необычное, то вам точно сюда. еще классные коктейли с бурбоном. на десерт был индийский терамису и еще много всего. короче очень вкусно

It’s the best place for dates, ladies nights of just having cocktails with friends. Amazing view on Burj Kalifa, open area but at the same time restaurant hold a normal temperature for guests, so we have: 1) pleasant atmosphere 2) view on town 3) sneaks like fresh fries with truffle souse, salmon sashimi and good quality cocktails big portions

We went last night to the Blue Wagon for a lovely dinner. The service was fantastic - and the food was excellent. The waitress was just chatty enough for a lovely evening. The menu is limited, but the food is well prepared, the portions are a perfect size and the tastes are wonderful. We started with the prawns with passion fruit, chili and coriander and were gobsmacked! The taste was perfect - and prawns were served warm. The homemade bread and butter with seasalt was a wonderful addition. For the main I had the veal steak and my partner had the rabbit - which was tender and not dried out! The wine by the glass was good, but served only by the deciliter. And the dessert menu was too limited for us. We would have had a dessert, but they were only two sweet desserts and a cheese plate. We went home to have our own. Would definitely recommend this restaurant and we hope to return!

review_data.review_title: A wonderful evening from start to finish
review_data.review: We went to the Blue Wagon to start the holiday season here in Prague. We were not disappointed. Each course was absolutely perfect. We told the waiter that we couldn't decide what we loved more - the kulajda soup, the beef tongue in horseradish source, the deer tenderloin... It was all cooked perfectly and the combination of tastes was perfect for a cold Bohemian evening. The wine was good by the class, but pricey. The dessert was lovely - but an extra scoop of that lovely ice cream would have made our evening absolutely perfect. Definitely a restaurant to which we will return.

The first floor is by a busy pedestrian street with lots of life and motorcycles. They have a special vegetarian menu. Dissapointing thou, the serving took a very long time. My seafood soup was more a pale tasteless porridge without seafood. Vegetable soup OK taste, but with stews. Tajine with meat and raisins, OK taste but the meat could be more tender, and the bread was dry.
This was our first stop for food when we arrived in Siem Reap. Very nice friendly staff and their veggie curry was delicious . Thank you

review_data.review_title: Quirky original place, good food and amazing service
review_data.review: We really liked this cafe , such laid back place , friendly service and tasty food . Such a simple idea with amazing presentation. It had a choice of both vegetarian and non vegetarian options as well as deserts in spring roll version. Very nice concept !

review_data.review_title: A special treat for our anniversary
review_data.review: We came for a champagne afternoon tea for our wedding anniversary. The ambience, service and food and drink definitely made the day very special and did not disappoint. Live piano music in the background, tables spaced out nicely to make you feel Covid safe and comfortable and beautifully presented. All staff wore masks. The food and selection of teas and jams were outstanding. Really recommend trying rose petal jam and wild cherry tea. Altay, our waiter, was very attentive and helpful.  If you want to pamper yourself or a loved one then this is the place to go.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Two restaurants for the price of one!
review_data.review: The Sohhhak River is actually two restaurants, both of which have the same Khmer menu. The one next door is called the Charnery Tree and only serves the Khmer version. Sokkhak River, however, also has a French Fusion menu as well as tables inside with air conditioning, whereas Chanery Tree only has tables outside. As it wax another hot day in Siem Reap I opted to eat insid.  The French menu is really a Western menu offering mostly steaks, seafood and pasta main dishes for around $20-25. The Khmer menu is about half that price and looked much more interesting offering local classics like Amok, Lok Lak as well as the temptingly exotic Grilled Stuffed Frog, but as I was feeling less adventurous I opted for the Tonle Sap Steamed Fish ($11.50); Bar fish fillet with garlic, shallot, basil, spring onion, cashew and lime dressing. To drink with lunch I ordered a glass of the Obikwa Chardonnay from South Africa. Like all the red and white wines by the glass this cost $5.80.  The Chardy was nice - quite a lot of body with pear flavours. An easy drinking cheap and cheerful! The Sokkhak is very comfortable and stylish. There are two red and black display cases filled with small potted tropical plants, statues and other knick knacks that subtly divide the space in two, black tiled floors, contemporary local art on the walls, and dark wood sideboards where the settings are kept. I had a table near one of the windows that looked out onto a narrow breezeway filled with ferns that separated the restaurant from its sister property next door.  My main was delivered quickly and was very good. The fish was tasty and soft, and the sauce tart and flavoursome but not so much as to over power the main ingredient. The cashews added a nice crunch to an otherwise soft-mouthed dish. I think I did a good job matching the wine too as this complemented the dish very well.  I'd had the tasting menu at another high end restart just next door called Malis a couple of nights before which I really liked, but a couple of locals said this place was better. Personally I liked them both, but it's hard to compare the diverse tastes and experience of a degustation against a single dish. However based on the one I tried here today I'd have to call it a tie. I'd really like Chanery Tree/Sokkhak to introduce a tasting plate to their menu as there were a lot of things they do that I'd really like to try - starting, of course, with the stuffed frog
took my parents there. the atmosphere is fantastic. Wine is great and food is good too. A bit out of the centre but worth venturing out to.

We found the place here, on Tripadvisor. Thank you. We were very satisfied. Great value for money, nice food and a cozy atmosphere. We were hungry and didn't have time nor will for exploring, so Trip Advisor once again become very useful!
This is a great little place with a great food. Also a good value for money. Excellent for brunch. The coffee is great, too.

We love coming back to this restaurant as the staff are friendly and the food is of high standard.  Riccardo is one of the head chefs who has been in the kitchen for almost 10 years and provides guidance to the fellow workers.  Chad, Fern, Pope and Waan are delightful and always greet you with a smile.  The Spring Rolls and Chicken Satay are my favourite starters and As for mains try the Crusted Parmesan Chicken, delicious! The Duck is also delicious as is the Almaretto Sweet potato ravioli. Can’t go past the Cinnamon Apple Crumble or Sticky Mango Rice, teal favourites.  As there is a huge menu, including Thai Food, you will want to come back again.  Thank you for a great time. See you all again next time.

review_data.review: We have eaten hear many times and love the food and the hospitality of the waiters.  The burgers are awesome, especially the Thai Chicken Burger and The Kitchen Table Burger are delicious. There is a burger here also for Veggie which my partner enjoyed.  The Chicken Caesar is excellent as are the pizzas. My favourite was the Vegetarian and the Napoli which has anchovies.  The Thai people are lovely and the service is excellent. Thank you to our lovely waitresses Poppy and Asia who has looked after us on our dining experiences.  Ooo, by the way if you don’t feel like an alcoholic cocktail, try the Virgin Cocktails. Especially the Pina Colada and the Victorian.

Bill’s claims that they are among the top 10 best burger places in Manhattan. And I think they are right. The heart attack Chili & Cheese Fries is just stunning!  Great selection of beer and super friendly staff! Everything is fresh and served in a heartbeat!  Visit!

Lovely meal, served by delightful staff with great laid back entertainment. A really delightful venue. Book ahead and try for a table around the pool. Very romantic. My gluten intolerance was considerately catered for. The 14 miniature salad hors d'oeuvres were delicious. Great night.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We had lunch at this restaurant on Sunday July 6th.  When we had visited this restaurant, several years back, we were pleasantly surprised by the ambiance and quality of food. So when we arrived in NYC this 4th of July weekend, Utsav was the 1st restaurant that came to mind for Indian food. I made a reservation to make sure we had a place.  We arrived with a lot of anticipation, but were utterly disappointed, by the time we left.  The restaurant started us of on the wrong foot, by stacking up unclean plates. Every plate we picked up (from the stack of plates provided) had food particles stuck to the bottom. Either their dishwasher was spoilt, or whoever was washing the dishes, did a shoddy job. I had to pick through at least 10 plates (supposedly clean) before getting hold of a “somewhat clean plate”.  At the Appetizer counter, there was a man preparing chat. I asked him for a helping, and was told that they will bring it to our table. By the time we left, no one had bothered to get us the chat.  The food quality was well below average, and not commensurate of a restaurant charging over $20/person for the buffet. There were very few items, both for the vegetarian and the non-vegetarian palate. The food tasted like “production line” preparation. There were two desert dishes that were clearly below par.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good Indian food. Utsav has clearly lost its edge.
Great atmosphere in the bar at night, started off on wines then single malts. Very much enjoyed our hour or two here.

review_data.review_title: Upscale steak restaurant with excellent food.
review_data.review: It was recommended to us and we really liked it. The steaks and the samon were excellent, very nice atmosphere. Service was very friendly, quick and and proffesional. Prices are high but Food worth the money.

review_data.review_title: Upscale steak restaurant with excellent food.
review_data.review: It was recommended to us and we really liked it. The steaks and the samon were excellent, very nice atmosphere. Service was very friendly, quick and and proffesional. Prices are high but Food worth the money.
A very nice economical place, close to our hotel. The staff is helpful and efficient. The food is awesome. I especially liked the Mango salad with fish.
