review_data.review: This place in in the Anantara MaiKhao villas and has an amazing menu on sea food and other international dishes. Definitely you have to go for one of the fish still being cooked on one of the heated salt bricks, this technique allows your dish to stay warm while adding an extra salty flavor. We had the Red Snapper but you can try the Sea Bass, Lobster and even your steak. Worth every penny

Ok, so, I don't even know what to write except that this was so far in my life the absolute best culinary experience so far. We went without a reservation and were super lucky that another couple cancelled short notice and we were able to be a part of the experience, and it was an experience. The food was amazing, the wine was high quality and paired perfectly to the food. Nicolas was a fantastic host. I can't fault a single aspect of the entire evening. I can only recommend that everyone that has the chance to experience this, should do it. Definitely reserve before you go because they are very popular but if you don't go you are missing out on an absolutely amazing experience. If I could I would go here once a week minimum. Bravo Nicolas and your team. Thank you for everything and we will see you next time we are in buenos aires!

review_data.review_title: Good Service, But Very Limited Choices and High Prices
review_data.review: Good- but overrated… We looked forward to our dinner at Pur , but were disappointed in the menu. There were only four entrées to choose from and one was a cheese platter. The other entrée choices were sea bass , wyagu beef and sweet breads. My husband wanted none of them however he chose the wyagu beef. The sauce for the beef was excellent and he enjoyed it however at €135 it should be more than very good . I ordered the Seabass and found it adequate. The risotto with curry that came with the beef also had an excellent sauce. Some of the servers, including James and Amin, were very good. Leopold never brought the citrus vinaigrette I requested and seemed to completely forget it. He also had to be asked to serve us bread. There were many “extras” that were provided at no charge,but being very gourmet,required a receptive palate. I loved the artichoke appetizer bite with curry,but my husband didn’t care for any of them. We ordered a la carte,but with a €90 bottle of wine ( which was the least expensive Bordeaux on the menu) and coffee, our bill before tip was €333. We are world travelers and have stayed at some of the best hotels. Overall, I would give the food a B-. My husband gave it a much lower rating than that. If we had ordered the six course fixed menu with wine, the bill would have been well over €600. You would have had the same four entrees as well. Interesting experience, but we would never go back.

Run by the New Hope founder's wife, this excellent restaurant serves as a training ground for the school's students without sacrificing quality. In fact, our lunches at New Hope were highlights of our culinary adventures in Siem Reap. Both traditional Cambodian food and westernized items are available on the varied menu--all are well prepared with great attention given to service and presentation. The various fruit shakes are awesome, and I was impressed with the quality of their gourmet coffee selections (and I am VERY picky in this area).  The system behind this NGO facility is most impressive. A large number of volunteers assist the school regularly, but at its core lie a dedicated staff of locals committed to developing Cambodia's youth. The more you learn about the cause, the more you will want to seek this incredible restaurant out. It is well worth the effort to get away from the usual tourist venues and make your way through the city's backroads to sample this restaurant's offerings and get to meet some truly remarkable people.

review_data.review: Beautiful decor, each dining area seems to be kept small to give an intimate feel with no hustle and bustle. An amuse bouche was brought up with bread. Our meals of duck variation and veal fillet looked small but we're filling. The flavours were wonderful. Dessert was just as good. White chocolate mousse was a little dense and pistachio panda cotta was a little loose but tastes great. My wife had the dessert sampler, creme brulee, chocolate mousse and raspberry sorbet which she said ticked all the boxes. The praline and macaron petit fours rounded the meal off nicely. This is not my usual type of restaurant and way above what i normally pay but i didn't feel conned by the price and felt the whole experience was worth the money.

review_data.review: What a nice little find on the upper east packed with locals and many Asians which is always a good indicator. We had ramen, bao and katsu curry all of which was good.

Cocktails are great the bar staff are very knowledgeable & speak very good English, better than me after the visit, a must go to if you are visiting Prague. Not sure why they put olive oil on the peanuts though....
Burger was nice. I have had better but also a lot worse. Not a 5 out of 5 but easy a 4. Onion rings not great, chili mayo is spicy. Good price
Went there with my wife. Nice place with tasty food. Think the service could be better, it felt a bit stressed. Overall satesfied, but also had better experiences.

This is a bit of a trek if you are staying in central Prague, but taxis are cheap and it is definitely worth the effort.  The serving staff were brilliant, and helped make the visit so enjoyable.  We had some excellent dishes, and the steak in particular was stunning.  Some really nice desserts followed by some strong-tasting liqueurs they insisted we have helped finish a stunning meal.  Give it a visit, but book a table as it gets busy.

review_data.review_title: Not Just the Best Meal in Paris, but Perhaps the Best Meal Overall
review_data.review: In part we returned to Paris this year just to be able to have another meal at Le 114 Faubourg. It is our kind of place, elegant, but simple; refined but approachable; truly great food but without pretense. Beginning with an amuse bouche that was ideal for the Paris heat wave we were experiencing, the rest of the meal flowed as though it was individually designed for us. We will have yo return next year so that we can experience this amazing restaurant again. (Or perhaps we should just move to Paris!)
It was like eating in an oasis! Tables are dotted around this beautiful, winding garden creating very secluded and atmospheric spaces. Food and service was good and the prices were reasonable.
Delicious Banh Mi, including a vegetarian option. Very reasonably priced, and nice to sit on the mezzanine floor watching the world go by below.

I happened to be in the area and checked my TripAdvisor app to find a place for dinner. When I realized that I was only five minutes away from the #1 spot in Hanoi (according to TripAdvisor), I needed to try it. At first, as someone who lives in Hanoi, I was turned off by the idea that it's almost on Hoan Kiem lake. I thought it would be a tourist trap. It's not. And, the fact that you have to go down a tiny little alley and up a flight of stairs just adds to the awesomeness of the experience. From that alley, you emerge into a bright, cheerful and welcoming little shop. There's great outdoor seating if the weather is good and there's cool, clean air conditioning inside if that's your fancy. The staff was incredibly nice and talked me through the process for selecting my bowl. It was absolutely delicious. And, the fresh orange carrot juice was great too.  And, one of the key reasons that I'm giving this place 5-stars (and not just because everyone else seems to) is that they are also very ecologically aware. They offer bamboo straws, bamboo chopsticks and wooden spoons. All of the cutlery was therefore biodegradable or reusable. I loved that. Oh, and the juices were in reusable glass bottles.

review_data.review_title: Warm welcome and truly delicious food

The host recommended the sardine on hot plate dish...it was both original and scrumptious. Copious curries with a stack of poppadoms and delicious chuneys. Reasonably priced wine selection plus of course Indian beer. We were stuffed and couldn't cope with dessert, but we thoroughly enjoyed the port offered by the host. A wonderful experience. On our must visit list.
Had a really nice meal here ……nice views , friendly staff and a great place to just sit and relax . Will come back .

Had a very good meal here . Small menu but great options and everything well cooked . Good , friendly service and will return .

The best pizza we had in New York and just as good as the pizzas we have had when visiting Italy. We both had a small pizza but that was plenty big enough for us. Great pizzas and great desserts too. Definitely worth visiting.

review_data.review: After so many great recommendations I tried it once for breakfast. Rude waiter and limited buffet style breakfast. For two avocado toasts and coffee we were charged 160€( for 2 persons). While paying waiter told us also some unprofessional things. Not a pleasant experience.

For a quick and casual meal at Atlantis, we headed to The Edge. This outdoor bistro/bar offers a range of super tasty meals and a wonderful service. We were served by Ekene, who was friendly, professional and proficient. His recommendations of dishes were well selected and true to his descriptions. Ekene made our experience at The Edge a great one. I recommend The Edge to The Atlantis guests and day visitors alike.

The welcome at the restaurant was friendly and professional. We were shown to our table and attended by Asmita who was friendly efficient professional and informative without being over attentive. Food was full of flavour and extremely good .would highly recommend
Great experience. Team took very good care of our table and the food was delicious! Will definitely come back.

review_data.review_title: Minimalistic effort in the kitchen and decrease in general
review_data.review: This used to be my favourite restaurant in Cambodia but the service and food have decreased with the fame of this place. I booked a table online 1.5 days in advance and the one nice table, in front, outside which I asked for, when walking in, the waiter told me that there was a bad smell at this table and I should either sit inside or out the back, which is not nearly as nice as the seats out front. At one stage we were told that our main dishes would be out in 3 minutes... They arrived 15 minutes later. I ordered the chicken with spicy basil and asked them to cook the dish extra spicy. What they did is cook the dish as usual and put a spoon full of fresh, chopped chillies on top of the dish, why would a good cook do something so minimalistic? They offer no complementary water... many other restaurants do, you can order a 1.5 liter bottle of local water (not carbonated) for $4.50 which is outrageous for Cambodia.

This restaurant is clearly my favourite in Cambodia and I also find the prices reasonable, for what they offer. They have an amazing variety and each dish is absolutely amazing. The staff and especially our waiter Sros are very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive... He could even tell is about the flowers decorating our table. I hope my wife agrees to visit this restaurant on all 4 nights of our visit in Siem Reap. Do not miss this place

Things were about to go downhill very quickly when we arrived for our reservation and there had been a mix up and they had booked us in for the following Saturday. We had the proof on our phone that it was indeed their error. The great thing is that they handled this issue professionally and without fuss. We were taken upstairs to the cocktail bar for drinks and to wait while they shuffled things around to accommodate us. We were so relieved as we had been looking forward to coming here for ages. Finally we were seated in the restaurant and had a lovely evening with lots of delicious food. We especially enjoyed the starters - the scallops and the hare. The hare unfortunately had a couple of rogue bones but it still tasted amazing. For dessert we shared a beautiful fondant and they also gave us the petit fours seeing as the first attempt at our fondant had apparently collapsed. The Bunker is a wonderful restaurant and they know customer service.....any place can have issues but it is how they handle those issues which demonstrates the quality of their service.

The food and atmosphere here is wonderful. We shared some olives to start followed by a very delicious risotto and heavenly prawn pizza. To finish we had a tiramisu which we really enjoyed. Exceeded expectations and we will definitely be back next time we are in Queenstown.

When we visit Queenstown, we always visit Tanoshi. The food is so delicious, the atmosphere is awesome and the service is great. The Aburi Salmon is a stand out for us - we love it. We enjoy taking our time, ordering izakaya style and chilling with some beers and sake. We did a sake tasting as well which was really good. We will keep heading back.

review_data.review_title: Delicious Mango pancakes and Ice mountain-good rest stop
review_data.review: We were so thankful to arrive here after walking in the hot sun. The mango pancakes and mango shaved ice mountain are simply delicious. There are many artwork and scribblings on the walls left by grateful customers. The Japanese couple was so gracious in helping us called our hotel tuk tuk. There is also the small Saboo Sabay shop within its compound. Strongly recommended when in Siem Reap.

review_data.review_title: Great Food, Great View, Great Service
review_data.review: This restaurant gets a highest rating on TripAdvisor for a reason. The menu is fantastic and wonderfully priced. You cannot beat the view. And the service is very good, especially from Huy, the captain. Make sure you try the Vietnamese pancakes: they are delicious!

review_data.review_title: A Magical Culinary Experience in a Magical Place
review_data.review: If you’re in Siem Reap for one night or more, make sure you dine at this restaurant. Beautiful setting, remarkable food, gracious (all women) staff and hospitality. The set menu is fantastic, thoughtful, authentic, and very reasonably priced. We loved it!

Upstairs restaurant offering Thai food of a sort. We were a group and ordered 2 starter/platter dishes. The platters arrived and the basis of the platter was “chips” - fried potatoes!!!! There were some mini pancake rolls, some soggy samosas and salad and carrots. $28 per platter. We should have left at that point or rejected the platters but as a group we decided to stay. The main courses came out and in essence.....was not a Thai meal - just Asian cooking. The sweet and sour pork was literally hardly any chicken - just a large quantity of pineapple in a sauce. Utterly disappointing and not a place to return to for a “Thai” meal.

Reservation was cancelled a few weeks before as the restaurant said they were closed for a wedding party. After several emails with Clara the reservation was still possible. I mentioned it was my wife's birthday and was hoping for cake or something, but disappointed that I did not receive this especially as Clara had mentioned this in her emails to me.  However the food was good, the service and the staff not the friendliest I found but the garden was nice.

Well what a surprise- the best food I have had in a week in Phuket. It was not expensive, the atmosphere was simple but pleasant. The food was perfection, tasty, fresh, and so enjoyable I found it hard to stop eating even though I was completely full. We meet the owners after we commented on how we enjoyed it and that just topped the night off. We only have three days left but I am coming back.

To me it's authentic indian food. Curry is quite spicy, luckily the have indications on the menu regarding spicyness. Beware if it has more than 1 chili symbol. Great selection of Naan, the cheese version is very tasty. Service was excellent. Not too crowded during dinner.

The food is really tasty and has excellent quality. Price range is medium.

i was here for some drinks with a couple of my friends. i have to say that the decor of the place does not do the drinks any justice. you would nevere have guessed that the drinks and the service was so good when looking at that dull decor. Our server Pavla was lovely and funny when serving us and the drinks were verry coorky and tasted good. i highly rekomend this place

Okay so this place is more expensive than most in area but the service is charming, the tasting menu is well balanced, fresh and interesting and lots of little portions that left us full by the end of the meal.

review_data.review_title: This is where the local goes - we miss this restaurant
review_data.review: We were very lucky to be able to find this restaurant. There are many Shanghai cuisine restaurants in China town and I can 100% guarantee that this is the best one by far. We found this restaurant on last Tue (by luck) and since then, we kept returning to this restaurant on the next 2 days before flying back to London on Friday. We just loved their foods! During our visits, we ordered many different types of foods like dumplings, chicken, pork, noodles, fish...etc. and they were all absolutely delicious! (please see my photos for your references) The foods were cooked to traditional Shanghai style and were faultless. I also noticed that most of the customers were local Chinese and it showed "this restaurant is where the local goes". The price was reasonable as well. We ordered about 5 - 6 dishes each time and it costed around $30-37 (including tea and soy bean milk) - which was cheaper than a number of restaurants in China Town. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to try the real Shanghai cuisines. We really miss this place as we still haven't found a Shanghai restaurant as good as this one in London.

review_data.review: The drinks were so interesting, the service was amazing and the free bar snacks were a very welcome bonus!

After walking around NYC for a few hours we went for a quick bite to eat at Tommy Bahamas - Love their Tuna Tacos, they are fantastic!!! As always the food and cocktails are outstanding, but this evening the service was very slow and they were out of sodas - come on out of sodas at 9.30 p.m. on a hot summer day? 3rd year on the trot in Prague 3rd year we have eaten here. It’s a gem for those who like opulent surroundings and traditional Italian food. Stunning starters, mains and deserts and a fantastic wine menu. Relaxed, not rushed and well worth a visit for a special meal as a group or perfect for a romantic meal for two.
