review_data.review_title: Not that this restaurant needs another 5* review...
review_data.review: ...but I'll add to it anyway!  My friend surprised me with a visit here for my birthday, me a vegetarian and her very much a carnivore. The food is incredible! So many amazing flavours and the chef has clearly put a lot of thought into how the dishes all go together.  Not only is it delicious, but it is greatvalue for money. £20pp gets you the grande selection - a tapas-style offering of nearly everything on the menu. It's more food than we could eat (and boy did we try!). Favourite dishes included the cashew cheeze, the homemade pakoras and the two curry dishes.  You get free top ups of any dish you want (we couldn't manage that) and they give you doggy bags to take away your left overs. The vegan brownie we had for dessert was TO DIE FOR. Oh how can it be so rich and crispy and gooey all at once, and accompanied by delicious vegan ice cream.  You bring your own booze but we also tried the delicious complimentary tea at the end. They were also kind enough to give us little pots of the tea mix to try at home!  The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, with everyone cooing when their selections arrived, and the staff were incredibly lovely and helpful.  This is a gem in Earlsfield and I'll definitely be back, bringing friends (veggies and non-veggies alike) so that we can feast again!!

The place to go in Dubai when you are out of india and longing for authentic indian fare. The service is at par and the menu is never ending, i would alert that you choose quickly else you may end up spending 30 mins looking at whole menu. The taste is good and would rate the service higher.

Not the cheapest restaurant, but a real treat and the quality of the food is excellent. We had spring rolls which were really fresh and tasty and you could tell they had been made to order. The soup with red nets in it was also really delicious and very different. Not just a gimmick they really add a flavour to the soup. We were on the top level and you feel so far away from the madness of the surrounding town. A real treat for one of our first nights in Cambodia. The staff also got us a tuk tuk to get home as it was pouring with rain when we were ready to leave. Excellent service all round.

Wonderful food and lovely staff - even going out in the pouring rain to put covers down to stop rain coming into us. We had Mango salad. Fish Amok and banana and chocolate samosas. All of it was fantastic and would highly recommend it. Really fresh and tasty. Very reasonable too, given the quality of food. Lovely to talk to the staff too about Covid and their plans for the future. They look after their staff and shows in the quality of service they provide. Some of the best food we ate in Siem Reap
We have always had a good experience here with the kids and would recommend . Informal fun dining experience
While the food, taste and presentation both , was excellent.. we specifically loved the swing seating! Make sure you have reservation before visiting, as there are limited swings.

review_data.review_title: Beautiful food in a beautiful Riad
review_data.review: Owned by a Celebrity chef in Morocco, the food keeps up the reputation. The restaurant was busy and reservations are recommended. WE got a nice table by the pool. Being, a vegetarian, they were very accommodating to my dietary needs. they have a set menu and each dish is great. Good wine selection and decent service. Definitely a must visit in Marrakesh.

What an amazing little gem is this. Away from all the New York noise is this small little Italian place. The place was empty but vibrant. They had an open kitchen which was awesome. Over the radio were some classic American tunes and the waitress spoiled us with attention. I had the prosciutto pizza... Outstanding! When it got a bit darker outside they dimmed the lights, lit the candles and turned up the music.... it could have been the red wine, or the heat from the oven, but I felt a wave of warmth coming over me.... something that said "I'm feeling pretty relaxed now". This place is on my list next time I'm in the Big Apple.

Well, we finally got to eat here and we enjoyed it all! The food, the service and the ambiance were perfecto! Our waiter Noah (Noe) was wonderful and his recommendations were right on with the wine and the food. Not being rushed to finish your meal in NYC is always an issue. NOT HERE. The dining room was full and no one was rushed at all. When my husband request a little cheese and some proscuitto it appeared even though it was not on the menu! The foccia bread was amazing, we had to ask them to take it away so we had room for food. Great wine list! The my salmon was cooked perfectly and our dessert was eaten even though we had no room. Had to walk it off to the parking garage:)

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Thrill Seeker;Shopping Fanatic

review_data.review_title: Good food, good service, at a good price
review_data.review: We had a very enjoyable dinner and time at this place. We had the chicken spring rolls as a starter. A t-bone and a tenderloin as mains. And several margaritas.  The service is attentive and very friendly.  A bread plate is served which looks just like cut sliced bread but is in fact quite nice and we had a second helping.  The spring rolls were good and the accompanying sauce is not overly sweet as is often the case, but not here.  The t-bone was very nice. A bit of char and smoky flavour. It was ordered medium-rare and came slightly over but it was still heartily enjoyed.  The tenderloin was a much thicker cut and also ordered medium-rare. It came slightly under.  The presentation of the steaks and the condiments is excellent.  The margaritas were very good and generous with the tequila.  Coffees and more banter with the staff finished a very enjoyable night and our best meal in Siem Reap over three days.  The food for the price plus the service makes this place a winner. Slight variances in done-ness of the meat did not detract enough for us. We would return to this place anytime we are in Siem Reap.

The atmosphere is warm and tropical so a perfect place to eat when you want to escape the hustle and bustle of NYC. The food is light and delicious. I always get the Ahi Tuna tacos, even though they never fill me up. The staff is very friendly

user_data.user_tags: Like a Local;History Buff;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We went for lunch. The food was fresh and delicious. The portions are small and the prices are on the high side, but you are paying for the Tommy Bahama name and atmosphere. Plenty of space between the tables, bright summer colors and plenty of light so you get that tropical feel. The location is good but since it is on top of their store, it is not an easy place to find.
I went there with a family according to the good reviews on TripAd, and we were not deceived at all. Food is excellent and well presented. Better going there before eight at night.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We tried to get into 2 of the other restaurant’s that are combined with this one but could not get in but we are really glad as this place was lovely the food and the service was extremely exceptional

This is the second visit, first time was pre COVID. The quality of food has not changed. I chose the Vietnamese menu. Tasty, delicious and authentic flavours. Service was impeccable with an ambience to match.

We went here because we were late to book some other restaurants while staying in Paris. So we did not expect much. But then we got all and even more. Small place with just the right decor and really excellent staff. We did not go for the caviar tasting menu that is a signature of this restaurant but got caviar with the second entree. Very good. But also all other dishes from the tasting menu were lovely balanced in taste and imaginative as well.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Burges were great split the 5 slider option. Plenty of food. Only complaint was the onion rings were really onion crumbs.

It’s a very pleasant setting and it’s excellent reputation is probably deserved. The service is again attentive and friendly, big gap between main and desert....cheese actually, but otherwise pretty good. The menu was broad and you’d be hard pressed not to find an interesting option. The salmon looked good, my mushroom spaghetti was really tasty, stroganoff looked huge. It ain’t cheap, but plenty of Phuket restaurants aren’t these days. It’s a slightly out of the way setting, but that’s ok. Finished with a very pleasant port...Oh, the cheeses were fine, but the accompanying biscuits....probably the only disappointment of the evening. The boss is in evidence, orchestrating the operation , he’s charming and runs it well.

It is our last evening in Marrakech and we decide to go to Le Baromêtre. It is about 2.5 km walk from the Medina, but taking a cab is not unwise because the restaurant is quite difficult to find....  But when you have found it, you enter a great entourage, inspired by the period of the reclamation in America. Alcohol was forbidden, but it was drunk in illegal cafes in cellars!  We start in the bar, where two gentlemen make some spectacular cocktails for us. Definitely not cheap, but just the experience of watching is worth it!  Then to the restaurant. We take different starters and main courses and everything is equally great. Excellent dishes, highly flavored, attentive and friendly service! Because of the cocktails, the food, the service and the entourage we had a super evening!  We wonder why Michelin has not found this restaurant yet!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: One tray is perfect for two people with some leftovers for a yummy lunch. The lamb is fantastic. It seems quite expensive but when you look at the quality of the food and the amount that you get it is actually really good value. Highly recommended.

Hands down the best meal I've ever had in my life. It is amazing. They do a set 3 course meal for 95 Dirham which is about £8. The staff are so so so so friendly. You need to pre-book for a night or two in advance as they never have walk in space. You just have to go, its amazing!

We had a late lunch here from the Lunch specials menu which is offered from 1100 to 1500 weekdays. I am told this restaurant can be very busy in the middle of that period. Presentation for a budget priced special was excellent, the food was well prepared and tasty, the service was efficient and unobtrusive. Recently refurbished so the decor and furnishings are all in good order. We will certainly re-visit.

user_data.user_tags: Nature Lover;60+ Traveler;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review_title: Good food, Good entertainment - but at a price
review_data.review: Had a deal via Groupon for half price. Very good tasty food, cooked and served in front of you with great pizzazz. However the drinks are expensive, and service is added on the original price, so it all mounts up. This branch is all underground so no natural light, I prefer the Piccadilly branch as it feels more airy, and has windows. Definitely go and enjoy the fun once, but be prepared to pay for good food and entertainment.

review_data.review_title: Excellent restaurant with pick up & drop off to your hotel
review_data.review: Really lovely setting, with first class attentive service. Tucked away in a tiny back street. Follow the orange lanterns from Charles de Gaulle street or use the free tuktuk service.
We ate here twice the food was of a good quality and the staff where helpful, all of our food was delicious and well presented , and good value for money

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;History Buff;Shopping Fanatic;Family Vacationer

review_data.review_title: Early dinner to watch the sunset great food,great surroundings,superb cocktails wonderful service from Makarau
review_data.review: We had a lovely early evening dinner and watched the sun go down on this roof top of this lovely restaurant,makarka served us so lovely and unobtrusive , great cocktails .

review_data.review_title: Not hugely impressed and very expensive
review_data.review: This is a very pretty restaurant on the beachfront at the Anantara hotel. The location and set up is very nice, and having a meal beside the beach with the crashing waves in the background is very romantic and soaking with atmosphere and style.  Service: The service was exemplary as expected at an Anantara. Attentive, helpful, and unobtrusive. They were kind enough to help move us inside to the air conditioned space which helped when it became too hot. They explained much of the dishes to us as well which was nice. When we left they got us a buggy to the reception and called our hotel and asked them to send a buggy to collect us. We were very impressed and pleased with this.  Food: The menu is very limited with only a few options for starters, mains and desserts. I was hoping for more seafood dishes and options. Their hallmark dish was seafood cooked on top of salt bricks. Heating the bricks and cooking it on top allows the seafood to absorb some of the flavour of the exotic salts. It felt gimmicky and I could not really taste any great benefit. I ordered the prawn version and it tasted like regular grilled prawns and was nothing special. I hoped to have some of the famous Thai flavours and passion reflected in the food. But I found the meal a bit bland. Don’t get me wrong, the food was fresh and all was very well executed but the mains were really not that interesting. The salt sommelier was there to assist with different types of salt to enhance your meal. I am a fan of interesting salts but again, this felt a bit forced. I could barely tell the difference between the salts and quite frankly, didn’t care. I just wanted to really good, tasty seafood. The starters were very good – most especially the rocket and pear salad which was quite WOW but a very small portion. The desserts were nicely made but nothing extraordinary. There was also a seafood feast but for the price, did not seem well worth it.  Price: This place was very expensive. I dont normally mind paying for good food but this felt unnecessarily expensive for what it was. I love Ananatra as a hotel and frequently dine at their restaurants even when I am not staying with them but the pricing of the is menu felt much too expensive for the food you were getting. Even if the price were lower, I would not be keen to come back again as I don’t find the food (except the salad) worth the inflated cost. It is a rarity that I do not like an Anantara establishment but the balance of value for money for atmosphere – made me feel disappointed.  I would not go back again for dinner as nothing interested my taste buds. I would not mind to have a drink or light snack there but as a dinner, I felt I could get better food, variety and price at one of the other dining options on the hotel property.

review_data.review_title: For entertainment, not for the food
review_data.review: I have never been much of a fan of teppanaki food for the taste as it is inevitably bland and boring. Benihana is a legend in the teppanyaki cuisine and for what it is, it’s fine. This is a place for food theatre where people go with their kids / friends for a fun evening.  Service – the service is good at this Benihana. The reception was nice and efficient and the waitresses are nice, drinks and non-teppanaki items served quickly and they did a good job with special requests on the table. Chefs were fun, engaged the kids and put on a good show for everyone.  Food – Ordered the cod with miso and a side of scallops. The fish was good enough, but the miso was added as a sauce (vs glazed on top) which was disappointing. The unique black cod taste was lost on the grill and the luscious oiliness of the fish was lost. My son ordered beef and eat everything as it was served medium so soft to eat in bite size pieces so he liked it. I am not a fan of the food and only attended on the request of my son.  Value – teppanyaki is always expensive. My young son and I had 2 mains, 1 starter and a glass of wine and it cost us £90. Every time I pay the bill for a teppanyaki dinner, I vow never to come back and year after year the kids beg to come back for the show which obviously made the meal delicious to them.  Benhihana does the teppanyaki show well and kids and groups will enjoy the experience. It seems fully booked all the time so there is certainly an audience for it. But it is not good value for money, and the food is uninteresting and bland (even with their sauce options). If the kids have a great desire to go then we may consider going back, but never for any other reason.

review_data.review_title: VERY good food and good price
review_data.review: I went here with a vegan friend and got the recommendation of Tripadvisor. All is true: very good food, lots of choice. Good (cheap) prices and good service. Liked the restaurant itself as well. Gin tonic USD 3, had a chicken red curry (USD 3) and my friend a vegan dish (3 USD) and was also tastful. Servants friendly and fast.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Backpacker

review_data.review: I cannot speak more highly of this restaurant — from its mission, to the service to the food — everything was top notch. Their mission is to train disadvantaged youth to work in the hospitality industry. They have a 16 month training program and support these youth throughout. Our servers were a mix of newer and experienced people. Everyone truly cared that you enjoy what you have, and the atmosphere. We had some outstanding food, including a tofu sate (the peanut sauce was to die for), the pumpkin soup (creamy and rich), the fish with mango salad and bananas in coconut milk (yum!). We ate in the courtyard which was quite charming. Reasonable prices. 5 stars!!

I have to admit based on the location, website and price point we were expecting a "wow." It looks like the restaurant is under Michelin consideration and they need to step it up. Lovely decor and presentation, but the food somehow just doesn't live up to expectations. We have traveled to India and are frequent diners at the small places in Edison, NJ (little India) -- places where you get wow (but definitely NOT atmosphere cheap). Utsav is very convenient to theaters, and has a prix fixe menu. We did a combo of small plates, entrees and dessert. The small plates were both excellent -- traditional samosas and a quinoa potato patty. The mains less so. The menu has a combination of traditional and different, and my husband's Baingan Bharta (eggplant) was enjoyable. I had the Shrimp Goa, which was supposed to come in a coconut sauce. It was basically Shrimp Tikka Masala, and it was overcooked. I mean to the point of tough. I've had that issue in Indian places before, but that is a rookie mistake to be sure. Short on time I did not send it back, but also did not love it. The dessert was again quite good, a traditional kheer but with coconut sorbet in the middle. The entire meal cost $150 for 3 people (tax and tip included -- no alcohol). In Edison it's usually about $65 and we have tons left over. I highly doubt we will be back.

Their slow cooked lamb shoulder is that tender it just falls off the bone and melts in your mouth, so yummy. Accompanied by seasoned scalloped potatoes the $45 meal deal advertised for 2 has enough meat and potatoes to easily feed 3 people. Based on what other takeaways and restaurants charge in this town this represents a good value. Give it a try you won't be disappointed.

We had a wonderful experience! Traditional Japanese food with Japanese chef - totally authentic! Service was excellent by our waitress Janine, made us feel absolutely comfortable and took great care of us. We went for the a la carte sushi menu, and had the Takumi Platter for two: salmon, tuna, eel, snow crab, yellowtail, shrimp, salmon roe… everything you can dream about. Additionally, we have a Snow Crab Roll, which was really good, and a delicious Scallops Sashimi - super recommended. A must go for any authentic Japanese food lover!

We had an amazing experience! Was looking for a good pizza in Seminyak, and this one answered all my questions. Good and friendly service as well, pleasant live music, not too loud to the point where we can’t carry on conversations. Everything was good. Ended with a nice tiramisu, shared and approved by everyone on the table. Will come back for more.

Great food - recommended  to us by others, we found ourselves in the area, so popped in. The fish amok and shrimp (prawn) Tom Yam were amazing. That and 4 beers was $9 Tasty and a bargain - highly recommend.

For some reason I expected to find asian dishes (like ramen and gyozas) but it is mostly a burger venue. But a great one, maybe best chicken burger ever, with great asian twist. Interesting options in the menu, might stop by here again....

The restaurant is very nice. It has tables outside near the street, is has very attentive service, who is quite friendly and customer focused. They even tried a cocktail that we wished for even though it was not in the menu. Food and drinks are very good and the atmosphere is perfect. Nothing more to say other than that I can recommend it! Try it out yourself!

The menu did not indicate many vegetarian dishes, but I asked for Pad Thai without meat and it was made with tofu and extra vegetables and was very good. I didn't particularly like the selection of starters. The vegetarian starter included fried spring rolls, which are unusual in a Thai restaurant (they usually have the type with rice paper that are not fried), and deep fried, battered vegetables, which in my view defeat the purpose of eating vegetables. I did not order wine, but my friends did not care for the wine selections--surprising since it is not difficult to find good wine in New Zealand. The wait staff was good-natured, but not at all knowledgeable about wine.

Come for the cocktails as they are so good and very unique in style  I chose a be delicious which arrived with a tooth brush and tooth paste (raspberry pure) the cocktail was amazing but the attention to detail was fab, I touched the wet tooth brush and it tasted minty fab  We saw other cocktails being made, some with dry ice and others being served in a trophy.  Not to far of the heated track, well worth a visit

We were staying close-by and noticed Bill’s Bar and Burger, so we tried it. Place is nicely decorated and staff is pleasant. Seating was separated, which was good. We ordered cheese burger and fries. The burger was good but fries not so. Of for some just right really good fries, - not these. It was not a bad place for dinner, nor was it outstanding. In a pinch - try it.

review_data.review_title: One of the best slices ever.
review_data.review: Stopped in to try the pizza slices, very good value and amazing taste. Try the nonna maria slice- so tasty!

review_data.review_title: Best Greek food outside of Greece and better than most inside
review_data.review: Returned here for a meal after 6 years. I remembered how good it was Last time so had high expectations. I am pleased to say that they were met. A wonderful tasty meal, super friendly staff, great atmosphere, super clean. A absolute gem of a place. I traveled a four hour round trip just to eat here and well worth it. Will I return again you bet I will.

review_data.review_title: A m a i z I n g
review_data.review: Great diner. Very good quality meat and dishes. Restaurant was lively and my server Sros was spot on. I will be back just for his warm attitude and smile. Thank you.

review_data.review_title: Do not miss this terrific dining experience!
review_data.review: We’ve been in NZ for 10 days and this was one of our top 3 meals: outstanding food coupled with superb service.  Believe them when they say a large plate is good for sharing. We shared a dozen oysters (small plate) and then my husband and I each got a large plate because we like different things. The chicken thigh is def shareable. It came with a veggie medley of fresh peas and chopped zucchini with a lovely mint flavor. DH had the whole baked sole, probably not too much for one person. We did get the peas/broccoli/baby spinach side - very nice substitute for a salad and also shareable.  But the best part was the Pavlova - especially shareable and just to die for.  Public was really busy but our server - actually the entire staff - never missed a beat.  This place is a must if you are in Queenstown.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Like a Local;Nature Lover;60+ Traveler

review_data.review: Another special meal! We really were craving authentic pasta and were lucky to score a reservation. Terrific food and great service from start to finish. Many places we’ve been to seem to thrive on chaos, but this place seemed very well run and the manager was completely cool. My husband and I shared the Caprese salad, and then we each had a pasta dish. Finished off the dinner with dessert and coffee.  You def need a reservation, but the meal is worth the advanced planning.

review_data.review_title: Level Pegging For Best Restaurant Of Our Trip
review_data.review: We arrived in Prague on a Friday so getting a booking at any of the well known restaurants was impossible. Thank goodness our concierge new this place because I'm sure it is better than anything we would have chosen. Superb food,... attentive, well informed waiters and for a sunny evening the perfect conservatory style room decorated with flair. This is a fantastic find for those wanting the very best fine dining experience. It does not have a Michelin star yet but I'm convinced that it is not far away. My only negative note would be that wine by the glass seems mean even by French standards. It is a drop more than the average Australian tasting. BUT... food of this quality for $70 a head is hard to beat. Only one restaurant has come near this place in our three weeks of travel so far. Almost perfection!!

A friend who lives in Siem Reap told us how good this place is and she was spot on!! Delicious food, great coffee and friendly staff. A winning combination. It was on the other side of town from our accommodation but worth going out of our way to find. Highly recommended.

review_data.review_title: Great Portugese Food at a Good Price
review_data.review: We ate at Frade dos Mares for lunch and it was excellent. We shared the shrimp appetizer. The sauce was sublime - deep and rich with layers of flavor and just the right amount of heat from the chilis. And the bread to soak up the sauce was fresh and crusty. The wine they suggested was excellent. I also had the sea bream, which was grilled perfectly. The vegetables were simple but delicous - sauteed with olive oil and sea salt. A perfect complement. A scoop of ice cream for dessert was a simple palate cleanser. My wife had the melted sheep cheese and it was a little strong. She had the seafood stew and it was a nice, subtle bisque.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;History Buff

review_data.review_title: Lovely experience, great food, excellent staff!
review_data.review: I went to this place for dinner on my birthday with my partner. Excellent environment, friendly, helpful and competent staff. We start with an aperitif and a couple of "cicchetti", the menu offers both a choice of tasting and an a la carte menu, we decided to order a la carte, tuna tartare (exquisite), cappelletti of veal and pappardelle with beef sauce (braised), both dishes fantastic to remember the Italian cuisine of the best traditions. Faraona ripiena, delicious, crispy on the surface with a melting filling. I believe that the quality of the dishes shows the competence and love of Theo Randall for the raw materials, the ingredients and the care and passion he puts into the preparations together with his excellent team. The dessert, ricotta cheesecake, was also very good, with a welcome addition of good wishes for me. Excellent wine list from which we chose a Nebbiolo delle Langhe by Ascheri 2019, very good. I had a perfect evening from all points of view. Thanks to Theo and his team!

Was visiting NYC on my birthday and wanted an authentic Italian restaurant dining experience. Traveling with my wife and 7 other friends so I didn't want to risk anything less than a top-notch eatery. Checked TA and searched restaurants in the area we were staying. IL PUNTO showed up at the top of the list. After reading many of the reviews, I decided to give it a try and made a reservation through OpenTable.  Was thoroughly impressed from the time I stepped inside. (Don't let the appearance of the exterior cause you any concern.) The place is small but well-managed. Several tables were full (7:00pm) and our reserved table was ready and waiting. The owner/manager greeted us and promptly seated us. From that point on, service was excellent. The menu (authentic Italian) was full of fantastic choices and made it difficult to pick an entrée. On the server's suggestion, I tried the cauliflower soup appetizer. It was exceptional. My main course, ravioli with lobster meat was a good choice, too.  Overall, the group enjoyed the meal with numerous complements on the food.  If you're in the Manhattan (Hell's Kitchen) area of NYC an want "real" Italian, stop at IL PUNTO for dinner (only open evenings). I don't think you'll be disappointed.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Hard to give a not so good review in these challenging times but Public Kitchen and Bar has dropped a few notches. Have dined here a dozen times over the past 3-4 years but a combination of significantly increased prices with declining food quality is a negative for sure. Calamari overcooked and of lesser quality, short rib with pasta quite average. Will try again in a few months.

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Thrill Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Been looking for a great pizza for a few weeks. The 4 cheese pizza was very delicious. The open air resto is very nice. My problem was that there were 3 empty tables and they were all dirty. The drinks were overpriced for the area. Still good food.

review_data.review_title: Great food in a beautiful setting
review_data.review: We shred beef Lok Lok, eggplant salad with sesame, Char koheung - fish dish and a beer to wash it down. Service was Ok but the restaurant was slammed with way to many large groups.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Lovely Burgers in Sad Man’s tongue ,large range of burgers named after celebrities all freshly cooked ,chilli sauce home made and lovely if a bit of a heat challenge but waitress gave separate pot of chilli sauce to my burger at my request Good service friendly staff ,given free shots as well from Staff on my visit As good a burger as I have had anywhere and prices fair ,chips were also lovely. Slight mix up with starters but quality of burgers made up for this so still 5 star review

Dan and Henri are extremely professional in attendance. Our dinner lasted about three hours, started on time and the food was delicious and different. The house fulfills exactly what is proposed: bringing people together at a table to talk about different subjects and prepared and served dishes masterfully combined with the most different and sparkling wines. I am Brazilian and share the table with a young American and Hong Kong, which was a beautiful memory and unforgettable experience. Well worth it and the proposition is true. Congratulations Dan and Henri besides thank you.
We came here for the cocktails. And we have not been disappointed. They not only look great - they taste good as well.
Spent one night here and enjoyed it. If you‘re in the area it‘s worth checking out and have some nice drinks.

(I wanted to headline to read “Meat lovers Heaven” but they have several vegetarian options that appear delicious.) But not for moi! We were warned to be early, and so it was. We were first in but the place soon filled. Salads were simple (&perfect) and the Maison foi gras was sensational (it came with its own wine ). Shared a blue cheese burger which was cooked perfectly. I ordered “a little more rare than medium rare & they nailed it. The Languedoc was recommended and was perfect, as was the complementary wine with the foi gras. The service?? Fantastic, treated like family, hope you are to.

Managed to squeeze in here last night and it was incredible. Our second time here (first was to see the jazz) and it was great! Have to say that ordering straight from the menu was much better quality than the set menu provided on the jazz night we attended.  My king prawn pathia was one of the best I’ve had before, my sister’s tikka masala was far from boring (tasted flame kissed, like proper tikka should) and the Bombay aloo was delicious too.  All of the curries are really chunky and flavourful - in other curry restaurants the sauces seem like they’ve just puréed all the ingredients then thrown in some onion chunks for texture. The food here is the opposite!  The manager is a really nice guy and is candid about how busy it gets/waiting times etc so you always know where you stand.  Sitara is just a lovely little family-run place with great food. We’ll be back!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker

review_data.review: This is the third time we’ve eaten at the Rajdoot and we’ll continue coming back again and again. The service is impeccable, there’s a good list of drinks and the food is always incredible. Everything is cooked fresh and you can really tell. We ordered for four and there wasn’t a thing left by the end - everyone was very full and very happy! Plus management offered us a complimentary digestif so it was Tia Maria and Baileys all round before we left. Best king prawn pathia I’ve had in London, and I’ve tried many. Already can’t wait to return!
Worth the wait. The long line was no lie to the great dinner. The prices are right and the flavors are great. We will definitely return during our next visit to NY.

review_data.review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review_data.review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

review_data.review_title: Fab cocktails in a nice garden setting
review_data.review: The cocktails at Wild are really fab. They don’t do dinner as such but have many different types of spring rolls. So, it’s like tapas. We ordered 5 lots of different spring rolls between the 2 of us and found that to be enough for dinner. We also tried 3 different cocktails, all of which were good. The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.

review_data.review_title: Mostly good but room for improvement
review_data.review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.

review_data.review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review_data.review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_data.review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review_data.review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

review_data.review_title: Reasonably priced food in a beautiful garden setting
review_data.review: The price of the food was reasonable considering the beautiful setting of the restaurant. $10.50 for 2 meals and a drink. We were served fairly quickly and the service was friendly. I would definitely visit again.

review_data.review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review_data.review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.

review_data.review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review_data.review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

review_data.review_title: Such a lovely Sunday experience! Brilliant taste and even nicer service 😊
review_data.review: Such a lovely Sunday experience! Brilliant taste and even nicer service  We stumbled across here as our last brunch before heading home. It’s a good location close to the airport but good parking outside too. The owner is so so friendly and welcoming and accommodative. We initially nearly didn’t go because I don’t eat egg but he mentioned they make vegan crepes too with buckwheat! Music to my ears… I had the veggie burrata, sundries tomato savoury crepe and my partner had the chicken crepe & a Nutella crepe. Must add the sweet potato fries which we had on recommendation are a must! Thank you for a fabulous brunch!

My wife and I had Breakfast at JW Cafe each morning, we must say the food offering is excellent so much choice and high quality. Service received from all staff fantastic particularly "Gift" an excellent waitress always smile and happy.

review_data.review_title: An very enjoyable couple of hours
review_data.review: Popped in to have a sardine dish that was recommended and found so much more.  The sardines of course were fantastic, but on top of that my wife had a tasty aubergine salad to compliment a pastille de poulet, which again was very good.  A Moroccan salad topped it off, all served by Ismael who was attentive without being overbearing and also fun to chat to as the time went on.  The Casablanca produces Flag Special beer and mint tea also went down well after a long day out and about.  Bazaar Cafe comes highly recommended, more so than some of the more expensive restaurants we visited during our stay!

review_data.review_title: Little overpriced but great tasting good
review_data.review: Me and my wife went here on our honeymoon as a treat - date night if you will! I had a steak and my wife ordered mushroom risotto. We accompanied this with a starter to share, some sides and a bottle of wine and some water!  Food - was very good. You would expect this from a 5* hotel but the steak was exceptionally cooked and the risotto very tasty although slightly creamy. Wine was very good and matched our food - overall a great evening.  We paid roughly £95 which although I expected from a 5* hotel is very excessive and I think too pricey. I was personally expecting to pay more £70 however a good night, great food and good service - would recommend!

What a wonderful oasis after walking Rockefeller Center and Central Park ~ just wanted to stop in for a drink and warm up a bit.... couldn't have picked a better place. The restaurant is above the store so i'm sure many folks have missed it. The best Key Lime martini ever....... I felt like i was in the Keys! hostess and bartender were the best! Let us plug our dying phones in behind the bar and even found a IPhone 6 charger for one of us! We will most certainly be back!!!

user_data.user_tags: Foodie;Like a Local;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Family Vacationer

review_data.review: Amazing service and local food in the city Center.Reasonably priced dishes and good portions. We enjoyed our dinner there and everyone was really nice and kind. Also music is on point, had a lot of fun .

user_data.user_tags: Vegetarian;History Buff;Nature Lover;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: We dined here 3 times during our stay in Hanoi, and I have to say that the food was without doubt the best I have ever eaten in any hotel, amazing food and service.

Best meal in Ball. Excellent carbonara. Carbonara is a simple dish that often disappoints. Tonight it was exceptionally well cooked and so tasty. Home made Limoncello finished a great meal. Definitely will return

After reading many of the good reviews we decided to get a take out pizza.  We chose the Cremini Mushroom, which cost $18.50  When the box arrived we were a bit shocked at the tiny size of it but thought that it will surely taste great.  Unfortunately it didn't. 4 slices ( I thought pizzas meant to be huge in the USA) and tasted of nothing.  Very disappointed and would not return.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Great Indian food with and authentic flavour. Nan bread is one of the best I've ever tried. Service was good but only criticism would be why we needed to keep our cutlery between courses??

Just spent a week at Alcron and visited the Be Bop Bar most days. The staff there are excellent and super friendly. We did the cocktail tasting experience which I believe is only for guests of the hotel. Amazing! The amount of detail that goes into the story behind the signature cocktails is great. Best cocktail bar in Prague by a long mile. Also big shout out to Agaphetos (?) who was super friendly and welcoming.

This is a unique restaurant for its truly outstanding food and the chef behind it all, a national celebrity who trains aspiring chef. He himself was trained in Siem Reap and uses his grandmother’s recipes to create delicious dishes based on tradicional Cambodian food fused with South East Asian stuff. A absolutely adore the grilled chicken with the sweet potato and coconut milk mash, and the grilled rice balls/dumplings with chive. There are a lot of dishes for the more adventurous palate also, using local herbs and roots. All very very delicious indeed and very reasonably priced. On this trip to Siem Reap I visited 4 times in one week.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Its grilled chicken Khmer style with mashed sweet potato goes down as one of my top 10 meals. Its owner, one of Cambodia’s top chefs, tries to promote real countryside cuisine based on recipes which have been passed down through generations. The result is a creative display of interesting stuff and a delicious feast of flavours. It gets extremely busy at night so I preferred lunches. Prices are very reasonable. Not to be missed. Try some of the very creative cocktails created using tradicional Cambodian stuff like local Whisky and palm sugar.

One of my best meals ever and a wonderful discovery. Food is reasonably priced, and very very good. I would say Michelin-star quality: very innovative, wonderfully presented and just extremely tasty. I loved the spicy chicken wings in a delicious curry sauce and the Cambodian grilled chicken served with a fabulous sweet potato and coconut mash. Shall return tomorrow. The chef is well known in the local circle and is highly regarded. Is something who will be around for a long time creating wonderful dishes.

review_data.review_title: Flavorful Entrees! Need Better Desserts (3.5 Stars).
review_data.review: During my stay in Paris, I wanted to have at least one fine dining experience. I chose Pur' since it was a Michelin starred restaurant and they were open on a Sunday. Many French restaurants are closed on Sundays, so I was happy to find a one that was open. You should make a reservation. If I remember correctly, I think I made mine about a month in advance. The restaurant is located in the Hyatt hotel.  The ambiance is very nice. Typical of many hotel restaurants. However, it had a more loungey, but classy, feel which I found relaxing and nice. I liked the lounge like seating as opposed to rows of tables and chairs.  Come dressed nice - you do not have to be too formal - no gowns. But dress as you would when you go to a special occasion at church or formal work function.  I had the 6 course pre-fixe with wine pairings which included:  - Monkfish, Fennel, and Sweet Potato dish - Duck Foie Gras with Green Beans, and Quinoa in a Yogurt/Horseradish Sauce - Beef with Potatoes - A few dessert dishes  The staff was very accommodating to my friends peanut allergy, so I am unsure if the selections are in line with what they actual offer on their menu. I let them know during the reservation period and when we got there, they were very attentive to ensure that they met our dietary needs. In general, the service was superb. I feel confident in saying that it was the best service I had in Paris. Very professional and polite staff.  The wine pairings were superb. Everything paired well nicely. I did not like the port with dessert. However, that is not held against the restaurant as port is considered a dessert drink. I personally just don't care for port. Especially not with dessert. Not sure where that rule was established. lol.  I was a huge fan of all the entrees. It is very difficult for me to pick a favorite. I guess I would have to say the Monkfish. However, the Duck Foie Gras and Beef were cooked perfectly. I loved the layers of flavors. They were hearty without being heavy. They were nicely presented as well. The entrees itself would give this restaurant a 5 stars.  I gave 3.5 tar because of the desserts. I did not care much for the desserts. In fact, I do not think I really remember any of them. They consisted a big portion of the meal (8 in total I think). I do think I had a dessert with brie - and I remember eating it. This says a lot because no one can get me to eat brie. I usually do not have the pallet for it (it's possible it wasn't brie). But generally, the desserts were not memorable.  As an American, and this being my first fine dining experience of this caliber, it was difficult for me to get used to the tiny food. I am big into nutrition, and technically, the food is perfect portion sizes. However, it didn't prevent me from wanting a juicy turkey burger afterwards. I did not leave full.  I stopped at the restaurant bar after dinner. They had some very unique cocktails. I ordered the "Puki Puki" simply because I liked the name. It was a very beautiful and tastey cocktail. Very tastey cocktail - more memorable than the dinner wine. I vote that all restaurants should offer cocktail pairings with pre-fixe dinner. That would be nice!  The 6-course pre-fixe will run you about 235 Euro - not bad considering some other fine dining resteraunts were almost double.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Like a Local

review_data.review: Lamb and scalloped potato was amazing! Staying at a BnB made this the best choice when the weather poured down raining. Like having mums home cooking! Best decision when you want good quality take out... yum

review_data.review_title: Food is so cheap and excellent, I feel like I'm stealing
review_data.review: Awesome place near one of the night markets and we stumbled in for lunch and couldn't have been happier. 2 salads, 3 beers $8. the mango salad and the eggplant dish were excellent and the beers cheap and cold. What else do you need. Service is family oriented. I will likley go back but there are so many other great places to try---difficult problem.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Thrifty Traveler

review_data.review: Great meal, c/w smoothies for under $10. Cheap and cheerful, but very tasty. Three mains plus three smoothies. All female staff worked very hard and restaurant was full.

review_data.review_title: Another good meat restaurant in BA
review_data.review: I went for the Cabreara Sur and was redirected to this branch only one block distant (it was holiday and the restaurant was full). Specialized in meat, the restaurant located at Palermo has high prices (but good cost-benefit relation because of its quality).Service only OK. The meat was very good.

Don’t waste your money here. Go get a good steak somewhere else. At almost $20, the premium beef is very average. It is sliced extremely thinly. You spend half of your time cooking. Seafood is frozen. Mosquitoes inside.

user_data.user_tags: Urban Explorer;Thrill Seeker;Nightlife Seeker;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review_title: The best steaks in south America
review_data.review: We had a fabulous evening here. The steaks were the best we ate in a month in south america and the location, company and food was first rate. We walked here from our hotel in palermo soho and the area is safe to walk at night.

A friend had recommend Era Restaurant and it did not disappoint. A fantastic dining experience in Hanoi! The staff were all so attentive and lovely and the food absolutely delicious. I had the beef pho and my friend the fish traditional Hanoi dish. We also tried the eggplant in coconut curry and it was all so delicious. The little appetisers and desserts were a lovely touch. Would definitely recommend for a delicious and not expensive dining experience in Hanoi!

Best lamb I’ve ever tasted very nice restaurant and you would usually have to make a reservation to get into it but we were here during the Coronavirus panic so got in easily. The duck liver parfait was perfect to share between 3 people. When the world goes back to normal I hope this place opens again.

review_data.review_title: Good authentic Italian, perhas a tad overpriced
review_data.review: Risotto is a good test of Italian cooking and mine was really good. I'd eat here again but there are some quibbles. For example, arrive before 4 for a late lunch and you get small paper serviettes. While eating, you watch the waiters setting the tables for dinner, with good quality linen napkins. The same menu at the same price, why spoil the effect?

review_data.review_title: The best dining experience in Siem Reap. Providing training and jobs for 100 people a year!
review_data.review: We were staying one blok from Sala Bai and walked past every day but sadly saved our visit until the last. If we'd gone earlier we would have eaten here alot.  The restaurant and guesthouse provides comprehensive training to 100 Khmers every year - 70% of them women and all of them from very disadvantaged backgrounds. 100% of graduates (that's more than 800 people to date) have been assisted to find jobs.  The service is the best you will find in Siem Reap and the food is exceptional. You have the choice of a two or three course set menu of western or Asian persuasion or a selection of a la carte dishes.  I can't recommend this restaurant more highly. It's such a great social project - but the food and service cannot be faulted - so it's a win win choice.

'Nuf said. Best chocolate crossaint I've had this year so far. Hands down. The butter kneaded into each individual layer melts in your mouth. I love butter. Honestly, the pastry was so good I didn't mind as much that there was only a small button of chocolate inside.  I also had an iced coffee frappe with condensed milk. Sweet but nice and refreshing.  The almond crossaint didn't look as "artisan" made. It did however taste very homely and rich.
Excellent location in Greenwich Village with great outdoor seating on a nice night. Great pizza and I enjoyed a pasta plate as well. Cash only and place is always packed, That says a lot.

This was the best dinner we had in Prague! Even though the place is small it manages to be cosy and relaxed rather than cramped. The wine & food were amazing - following the recommendations of staff we found several wines we absolutely loved. Service was friendly. Really recommend booking here if you visit Prague.

user_data.user_tags: Shopping Fanatic;Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer

review_data.review: Very quiet evening when we visited - just one guy serving but it seemed like many people were getting takeout. Calm, relaxing atmosphere and food was good (just not as excellent as expected given high reviews.) Really good value for money.

review_data.review_title: Fun evening with friends but not great food or service
review_data.review: Recently went here for a friends birthday as a large group of 12. We had been put into a private room away from the main area - which we were glad about as it was extremely loud in the main restaurant. The cocktails list is poor - most sound fairly unappetising and the only few we tried were not great & we wouldn't have ordered a 2nd. One had an ice cube in which was the size of the glass so was an utter rip off for what you receive. Once at the table, we asked for the wine list which was apparently non-existent as the waitress came back & read 7 wines from her notepad (not being able to tell us anything about any of them)! She explained they were between wine lists, however even if this is the case its fairly poor for any restaurant to not be able to manage this smoothly. We opted for the safe option of Prosecco and beers - after our 2nd bottle of Prosecco, none of the rest of the bottles were cold which the waitress seemed pretty embarrassed about. She also managed to spill half a glass over my friend when pouring it out. The food was ok, we ordered starters to share (the prawns were tasty) and each ordered a main with some vegetables to share too. At the point of mains, you are basically paying for the spectacle only as the portions are fairly small & food is fairly bland & overcooked. I had the seafood special & the salmon was the best thing since its such an oily fish it could take the extra cooking. The lobster was unfortunately a bit chewy. The egg fried rice was also very blend. Each person also got a pair of ramekins with a couple of sauces - these were not nice & didn't compliment the fish at all, one being overly mustardy - assumably to go with steak. For the entainment value, its a bit of fun with a group of friends but I wouldn't go here just for the food. It was also very expensive for what it is - our bill was over £120 per person by the end, which was without desserts & there were a few people driving. I would rather spend that sort of money knowing I'm going to get much better food & service. Unfortunately, we won't be returning and I wouldn't recommend to any food lovers thinking of going.

Having been to many restaurants in Marrakech, the Dar Chef was one of the best in quality of the food and the service, whilst being one of the cheapest. Definitely a must go! Near the city center, easy to miss entrance, but that’s part of its charm. Used to be a family house. The waiter Anas has been very kind and efficient.

user_data.user_tags: Peace and Quiet Seeker;Beach Goer;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Fantastic poke bowls with good vegan and vegetarian options. Staff is friendly and nice and the food is very fresh and tasty. Wonderful atmosphere right by the lake.

Had a wonderful evening at this great restaurant. Cannot praise the staff highly enough. From the moment we arrived until we left we were made to feel extremely special. Our waitress was very knowledgeable and made us feel at ease. For people that don’t very often do Fine Dining we had a few questions about our food and the accompanying wine which were all answered professionally. Our meals were outstanding. I can’t really explain it much clearer than that.. The atmosphere was perfect and the restaurant couldn’t have been any cleaner. The waitress was also good enough to let me keep one on my phone for the Italy v Spain match which went a little way to making the evening even more special..

The 114 Faubourg was awarded a Michelin star in 2013. Chef Jean-Charles Cauquil achieved new levels of excellence in this very Parisian elegant decor. "Sautéed sweetbread and mushrooms in persillade, roast veal cooking juices" are superb as well as the selection of fish and the "Roasted red mullet, candied tomatoes with Colombo spices"...Excellent and attentive service, knowledgable sommelier and beautiful, relaxing dining room.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Urban Explorer;Peace and Quiet Seeker

review_data.review: Very perfect place. Vinaigrette is very very polite and provide all the necessary information about food

Well what can I add that’s not already been said about this place? It’s a hidden gem, you may walk past it thinking you can’t go in because it’s a hotel lobby- but please do! The staff are friendly, the surroundings a relaxing and comfortable and the cocktail menu is awesome! We had so much fun discovering what each one was about... we tried allbutone of the cocktails on offer! Brilliant start to the evening, so much so we went back at the end of the night for more!

In a lovely setting in Trifecta, this restaurant is a great choice for those who want high-end dining but not the tiny-plates style that leave you hungry and wallet depleted. In fact, the opposite is the case here. The very reasonable $75 prix fixe allows a wide choice of first and second plates, with tradition and experimentation side-by-side. For a group of hearty eaters, don't have a big lunch in advance--we were quite full after the two courses and multiple amuse-bouches, before the very good dessert selections. No complaints here about the pace of service, it was attentive, warm and friendly and not rushed. Definitely would return.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local
